text: This was an experience, the coffee wollups you while a present hippiness leaves the beer finishing like a beer. Its a kick of flavors and it is definitely bold, in the end its palate take away slightly and it just isnt quite all there for a 5, but it certainly is one of the better beers Ive had in my beer tastings.
On tap in Univ of Beer, Sacramento. Typical, but very well balanced imperial stout.
LCI. Poured from the bottle. Very good imp porter with loads of coffee and s bit of vanilla, perfectly balanced. Nice long coffee aftertaste.

From tap. Mmmmmm. Very nearly black, medium cream head. Smells and tastes of coffee. Nose is fresh roasted coffee beans and vanilla. Tastes dark chocolate, espresso, dark malts. Lingering bitter chocolate, coffee finish. Holds the alcohol well. Great stuff.

Optisch einwandfrei, bei 10% werde ich mal nicht über den Schaum meckern. In der Nase sehr intensiver Kaffee. Setzt sich im Trunk fort, dabei extrem gut trinkbar. Cremig. Schokolade ist auch dabei. Wenn dann nur leicht alkoholisch. Ausgezeichnet!

Bitterness is strong and it dimishes the vanilla taste and aroma. Strong coffee flavor as well. Except these two facts great imperial porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
aroma is very pleasant. theres something off about the mouthfeel, it could be flatter for my tastes. Otherwise a very good beer.

From the bottle. Pours cola black with thick khaki head that hangs around. Scent is cocoa, coffee, vanilla, and malts. Taste is big and similarly complex with coffee, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, and more. No alcohol to speak of despite the high alcohol content. Big body and very smooth. Finishes with a mild coffee bite. A really excellent imperial porter.
On tap at BeerTemple, Amsterdam. Nose: sweet malt, coffee. Taste: sweetness, coffee, chocolate then a roasted bitter. Pleasant mouthfeel, not watery.

This is the best beer ever. 

The only downside to this beer is my spouse calls it Defeat At Sea because I drink one and I am finished for the night. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried this in 2009 (pre-RB) in Manhattan Beach, CA. Now a retry from tap @ Beer Temple. Black color. Sticky, creamy beige head with good lacing. Aromas: vanilla, roast, mocha, vla/custard. Retronasal theres hard roasted malts, ground coffee, sweetness, vanilla. Flavor is roasted, light sweet, moderate bitter. Medium bodied. Long finish, moderate to full bitter. Good stuff!
Smakar precis som en kall cappuccino med svag ton av vanilj. Hade den varit snäppet tjockare i konsistensen, så hade jag gett den bättre betyg.
355ml bottle. Pours pitch black with a nice brown head. Vanilla, chocolate, lots of smoke, plums, a bitter finish. Fine.

Bottle. Hm, a hard to read stamp on the bottom, but no BB date - weird. Pours dark brown with rather big creamy head. Nice vanilla and coffee aroma, not much else. Tastes very sweet upfront with considerable dark roast coffee then on, some rather harsh coffee bitterness and roasty malts. But the whole thing just seems a bit too sweet. Fine, rather active carbonation. Dryish roasty finish. The biting ground coffee becomes a bit distracting in the finish. Pretty nice overall, far from excellent though... Hardly worth the above 4 average...

Aroma: bean, coffee, chocolate, caramel
Taste: moderate bitter, light sweet, coffee, roasty, chocolate, caramel

Bottle 650ml. Dark brown with short, beige head. Coffee and small chocolate in aroma but there are also some vegetable and booze notes. Coffee and chocolate in tatse but beer burns a bit in the throat and has a little bit spicy finish. Beer is tasty but note of booze disturbs a bit and causes the beer is not good balanced and finish is flat.

What a beautiful Porter. Coffee and vanilla all over the place (already in the smell)! Look wonderful, all black with a beige head. A fantastic coffee taste, mixed with some vanilla (a good combo). And the balance, not too sweet or bitter, just perfect. This one has been stored for a while (one more in storage).

Victory At Sea has a medium, beige head, a very dark brown appearance, with red shining through, at the bottom corners. There is a good amount of glass lacing present. Aroma is of rich, creamy coffee, vanilla, and dark malt, and the flavor is of those elements, with a rather harsh char, giving it a sort of burnt, acrid bitterness. Mouthfeel is low medium, and Victory At Sea finishes medium dry. RJT
I love this. Aroma of coffee and vanilla to go with the taste. Not overly sweet. Nice body. Head didnt last but otherwise a very good porter.

Bomber. Hueless deep dark brown, mostly lasting loose mocha foam. Aroma of dark roasted malt, vanilla and coffee. Taste is dominated by rich sweet vanilla, subdued coffee with a hint of chocolate, smooth roasted malt bitterness. Average carbonation, medium-fuller bodied, lightly hopped. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Bottle - Pours black, tan creamy head. Big flavors and aroma of dark roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, nuts, and creamy vanilla. Hops presence. Flavorful.
Piękna, brązowa piana. Bardzo intensywny aromat palonej, gorzkiej kawy. Brak kwaśności. W smaku kawa, wanilia, gorzkie ze słodką nutą - jak idealne espresso.
Absolutely wonderful aroma. Strong coffee with note of vanilla. Great carbonation. Quite Smooth. And the coffee.... absolutely top class ...

Bottle. Pours dark brown, black with a medium, frothy, latte-colored head. Aroma is chocolate, wooden, some roast, liquorice, vanilla, slight oak, cold coffee. Taste is vanilla, slightly wooden,roast, dry. Like cold coffee. Not too pleasant.

Bottle from Rickfifty, thanks a lot! Pours black, with a thin, barely covering layer of light gray head. Coffee, peas, some vanilla and smoke nose. Coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, smoke, leather, red fruit and berries. Heavy and roasted flavour, feels like a dessert on its own. Sweet, with heavy bitterness as well. Thick, full body. Medium, fizzy carbonation. Very good! A bit too roasted flavour to be absolutely super, but again, very good!
Poured from 1 pint 6 fl oz bottle. Black with tan head. Mild coffee with sweet vanilla and cocoa, hint of roast malt. Dry finish, sweet body.

Dark with small head. Robust coffee flavor, with cocoa and vanilla finish, not too sweet. Smooth. An extremely solid porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has licorice, vanilla, coffee, toffee, dark malt. Taste is malty sweet with long a bit bitter aftertaste. Flavors of coffee, licorice, vanilla, caramel, dark malt.

33cl bottle. Pour pitch black with moderate light brown head. Aroma has punch, liquirice, chocolate and coffee. Mouthfeel is light with notes of roasted coffee and malt. Warm alcohol finish with some bitterness. Very nice and complex.

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with small to moderate light brown head. Poor head retention and lacing. Moderate vanilla and coffee notes, pretty mild. Moderate malty profile - grainy, moderately roasted. Taste is semi-sweet with moderate bitter notes, increasing thru the degustation. Finish is moderately sweet, vanilla, coffee, slightly ashy. Medium body, oily and creamy texture, soft to average carbonation. ABV is extremely well hidden here. In overall nice, creamy and silky imperial porter with enough vanilla and coffee notes. Good brew.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Bottle 33cl from Alko. Pours clear dark brown, almost black, large beige head. Lots of coffee in the aroma, vanilla, some roasted notes. Coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate in the flavor. Bitter coffee aftertaste. Lots of carbonation, fizzy mouthfeel.

355ml bottle. Pours pitch black, with tanned frothy head. Coffee and vanilla, bit of roasted malts. Creamy mouthfeel. Vanilla is too strong for this to be my all time favorite, but very good none the less.

Pitch black color with minimal beige head. Nice aroma of chocolates, roast and hint of vanilla.Taste has dark chocolates,coffee, and some roast.Very full mouthfeel. Bitter coffee finish. Nice imperial porter
On se sinnepäin. Vanilja on makuna jotenkin teennäinen oluen kanssa. Eihän tässä sentään pullaa syödä. Hyvä, mutta ei porter-kärkeä.
Plenty of coffee, vanilla, roast with hints of earth and licorice in the aroma and flavor. Mid body with light carbonation bite, dry earthy finish.
Bottle. Pours a black color with tan head. Roasty, cocoa, vanilla, spiced aromas. Chocolate syrup, vanilla, cocoa, maple syrup, slight coffee flavors. Pretty tasty.

Totally black beer with a nice beige head. Aroma has lots of vanilla and its a fairly overpowering flavor, but the coffee is only a little behind. Very reminiscent of the Buxton Extra Porter. Vanilla also in the initial taste, roasty coffee down the middle and into the finish, which is also quite hoppy. Medium+ body, low carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Flavours are quite straightforward, missing that zing, but still good.

Ok stop, if you are looking this up on google and are considering this or some gamble of a strong IPA?!? Buck up, THIS is beer as it was supposed to be. Make the right choice...put down the IPA ;)
I know it may not be the douche beer review you may be looking for, BUT, if you like a strong dark beer- this one makes you just stare at the bottle and say " damn, THAT is reaaaallly" good.

335ml bottle from Alko. Wonderful nose and taste with exceptional lenght. This special beer reminds me of saying: A diamond is a chunk of coal that did well under pressure.  Henry Kissinger. One of the best.

330 ml bottle. Bought in Beervana in Santiago. Complex smell, hoppy at the beggining, creamy after. Vainilla coffe in there. kind of a prepared coffe, no the grain smell. Colour black with creammy yummy head. Fantiastic. Bitter taste with coffe ending. Gets better with time. Not notizable smell at all. Great packaging as usual with Ballast Point. A victory certainly.

Rami Rami is drinking a Victory at Sea by Ballast Point Brewing & Spirits at Konstruktorska Business Center

Kawa fajna i mocna, wanili malo, palonosci sporo, wytrawny, lekko kwaskowate posmaki, daje w sumie takie suche, popiolowe wrazenie. Ryli niezly


Rami Rami: W pokojowej temperaturze: nieco wiecej wanilii, ciut slodyczy wiecej i robi sie polwytrawne, lekko wzrasta tez kwaskowatosc...
Dziękuję Pan Mesjasz. Nie zawiodło - bardzo intensywne, palone, dużo kawy i wanilii, długi, goryczkowy finisz. Trochę mało ciała. Świetne.

Flaska. Svart öl med ett beigt skum. Intensiva dofter av kaffe. I bakgrunden hittas också choklad och torkad frukt. Smakinslag av nymalet kaffe, vanilj, rostad malt och choklad. Avslutas med en rostad ton. Väldigt, väldigt bra!
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Flavor is roasted, bitter, coffee, sweet and chocolate.
Sampel w Chmielarni na Marszałkowskiej. Aromat palony, kakaowy, wanilia. Smak dosyć wytrawny, palony, kawa i czekolada, trochę wanilii. Fajne piwo.

pours nearly black with a dense slowly forming medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts with coffee notes. Thick creamy mouth feel. Big black coffee taste with hints of dark chocolate and vanilla. Coffee bitter fades in. Solid toasted malt presence. Pleasant fading bitter and warming finish with some faint lingering vanilla. Outstanding!

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Black with a medium beige head, lot of lacing. Strong aroma of coffee, vanilla and cocoa. Taste is all about quality coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts. All flavours linger til the last sip. Absolutely delicious! Very smooth, full bodied and no booze feeling, soft carbonation, long bitter-ish finish. Here we are talking about a top porter!
On tap at Elizabeth Station. Pours a dark brown with a strong beige head. Aroma is cold coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is extrenly smooth (thx to nitro) with the same notes. Very good.
12 oz. bottle. Poured black with a lasting tan head. The aroma was sweet roasted coffee, roasted malt. Taste was bittersweet, vanilla, coffee, nuts, alcohol is apparent.

Deep dark brown coloured body with a nice, dense, four centimetre tall tan head with about 80% opacity in the body. Aroma of pure roasted malt, deeply roasted/burnt coffee and a good dose of vanilla and lighter oak and sweet notes. Full-bodied; Strong rich roasted malt flavours dominate with a lot of grain, alcohol, vanilla and especially coffee flavours that show well and have a lot of complexity throughout the sample. Aftertaste shows more roast from the malt and coffee than anything else, but the coffee and rich vanilla are strong as well, as is the oak, alcohol and rich toffee and caramelised sugars which hit at the very end. Overall, a nice beer that shows a ton of complex flavours, all balanced relatively well, and still provide a great body, smooth complexity and rich beer that is perfect when the weather gets a touch cold. I sampled this 32 ounce growler fill purchased from Whole Foods in Fair Lakes (Fairfax), Virginia on 25-January-2017 for US$5,00 (best deal ever) sampled at home in Washington on 27-January-2017.
Bottle at crafters Hyvinkää. Black with large head. Strong coffee, vanilla, strong bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Pours black with a beautiful large frothy caramel head, good retention and sticks all the way down. Intense roasted coffee aroma, malt, slight vanilla in the back. Taste follows suit, slight sweetness on the front and bitterness on the back. Alcohol fairly detectable, even more so with anything sweet. Low carb, creamy/smooth. Overall: Excellent beer and makes a great dessert pairing (like the chocolate cheesecake I had with it), but the additions are too strong and its just too decadent for my personal taste.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Pours black colour, opaque with creamy light brown stable head. Aroma: intense roasted coffee aroma, supported with vanillas note and dark malts, which takes on chocolate...flavor: similar to aroma; intense coffee & vanilla note, dark malts. Everything perfectly balanced. Body is thick, texture creamy, cRbonation is moderate.
Oily brown/black pour, thick tan head. Aroma of coffee. Body is medium and smooth. Flavor is coffee and herbs, but little to no detectable vanilla.
35.5cl bottle. black color. light brown head. taste of coffee, vanilla, roasted malts. mild bitterness.

Bottle. Pours dark brown-black with tan head. Bitter coffee and vanilla aroma. Bitter coffee and vanilla cream flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black in color with a sustainable tan colored head. The aroma bursts with robust mild to dark roast coffee mellowed out by smooth rich vanilla. The palate is treated to more of the smooth vanilla and bold coffee with a long roasty finish.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Dark, almost black-brown with a thin tan head that nicely laces the glass. Aroma is cocoa and roasted coffee with a faint hint of vanilla in the background. Lightly sweet, medium bitter, creamy and Id say fairly full bodied. Nice bitter finish. At its best on the warmer side of cellar temp. Very enjoyable.
Pitch black with a slight dark brown foam. Hint of vanilla, milk chocolate with some coffee notes. Sweet side. Well rounded, dessert like.

bottled. dark brown color. Aroma is malty, vanilla and chocolate.
Medium to full body . taste is chocolate, vanilla, mocha roasted malt
dry finish
black with a thin tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is vanilla, coffee, and malt. Flavor is coffee, vanilla, bourbon, and malt.

A 12 fl oz bottle with a Julian bottled on date of 16044, meaning it was bottled on 13th February 2016. Poured into a snifter. It poured an almost black colour with a just over one finger tanned head that had decent retention and left sparse lacing. Aromas full of roasted coffee bean, milk chocolate with hints of vanilla plus caramel. Taste starts with roasty malt and bittersweet chocolate, followed by light caramel sweetness and a hint of vanilla. Finishes with strong espresso bitterness. Creamy, medium to full bodied with low carbonation. Overall not getting as much vanilla as I would have hoped for, but still has nice roasty and bittersweet chocolate and coffee flavours.

.355l bottle @Harrys. Pours black with medium tan head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, oak, dark malts, chocolate, wet leather notes syrup notes. Flavor is bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, leather, dark malts, alcohol notes, some liquorice and ash. Greatly balanced smooth brew. Swell!

Pours opaque dark coffee brown-black. Substantial fluffy cappuccino colored head. Big coffee aroma, with chocolate and subtle vanilla. Taste follows the aromas, sweet at first, with a coffee bitterness in the finish. Dark roasted grain is at the heart, Palate is slightly creamy, rich on the tongue, Overall, its reminiscent of Kailua, without the syrupy sweetness. Outstanding!

Opaque black with some deep amber highlights; medium tan head with a bit of lace. Aromas of dark malts, bold roasted coffee, chocolate, hops, & a bit of vanilla bean. A lot of dark chocolate flavors up front. Intensely sweet in the beginning but transitions into a sharp, bold coffee note/espresso for the development. The strong espresso sticks around all the way into the finish but is accompanied by some creamy vanilla and a bit of warming alcohol as well. As it warms up, theres a raw sugary sweetness that comes through, which is also followed by a strong taste of alcohol as you can expect from a brew of this strength. The espresso notes are still there, but the vanilla seems to have disappeared. The mixture of strong coffee & alcohol really makes it tastes like a shot of espresso mixed with a shot of vodka.
M: Very full-bodied with low carbonation; the finish is bone dry; booze warmth throughout. The coffee/espresso is really prominent in this porter!! The flavor profile is, for the most part, dominated by dark-roast coffee notes with a hint of vanilla just to add some character. This is the coffee-lovers dream come true.
This is currently my favorite overall beer. Pours half a finger head, starts with a light vanilla and stout flavor and ends with strong coffee.

Near perfection. Vanilla extract aroma comes out of the initial coffee. Not too heavy with a great hop bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,33l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Pours black colour with no head.Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, bitterness, a bit spices. A tad sweet, bittery taste, thickish body. Great beer.

Bottle. Pours almost black. Medium white head. Herbal notes, spices, lots of coffee, hints of cocoa in the aroma. Quite spicy. Really strong roasted coffee at first. Bitterness and coffee beans in the middle. Chocolaty notes. Spicy finish. Coffee and hints of chocolate in the aftertaste. Rather heavy bodied. Really enjoyable brew.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is coffee grounds, creamy vanilla. Taste is strong coffee, coffee liqueur, bitter grounds... the vanilla smooths things out a little in the middle but ultimately I wanted more of it to even out some of the black coffee bitterness.
Draft at Ballast Point. Black pour. Aroma of soft roasted malt, creamy coffee and vanilla. Smooth taste of creamy vanilla, coffee, soft roast, chocolate and a creamy finish. Great porter.

Una Porter de color oscuro con una espuma beige generosa. Su aroma es a café y vainilla con notas de chocolate. Su sabor es a café capuccino, caramelo, chocolate Bitter y vainilla que mantienen un adecuado equilibrio entre sí. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Delicate. Sophisticated. Sweet, roasted. Vanilla. Coffee. Medium body. Some caramel.

Pours a dark chocolate color with a thick creamy head and good retention. Big aromas of brownie, strong coffee, strong chocolate/cocoa, vanilla, wood and slight smoke. Flavors strong coffee, strong chocolate, medium vanilla, wood, slight smoke. Medium bitter, medium sweet, slight astringent aftertaste. The bitter astringency is the only thing that turns me off in this tasty brew. Its not to strong but it does linger on the palate. The coffee and the vanilla stick out well.

Black color, brown head. Coffee nose, caramel, toffee, vanilla, roasted malt, muscovado sugar, hints of dark chocolate, cardamom and cinnamon. Rich and roasted malty taste, cocoa, vanilla, bitter coffee, well balanced, hidden alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Personal stats: Rating #1000
Draft at BP in San Diego. Over the top mocha aroma and flavor. Strong, sweet coffee flavor. Hard to believe this is 10% abv. Very smooth.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Almost pitch black colour and two finger beige head, that quickly disappears. Very pleasant porter/stout aroma with lots of nice coffee, sweet fudge, dried fruits and maltiness. Initial taste is great smooth vanilla coffee, some tangy dark chocolate and bitterness. Full bodied and well balanced despite the extreme flavours and strong alcohol content. Finish is sweet, a bit bittery and warming.
33 cl från Bishop Arms i Örebro. Riktigt trevligt porter som kommer att inhandlad igen.
12oz bottle. Black with a foamy tan head. Flavors are roasted cereals, chocolate, coffee, toffee and vanilla with fruity, herbal and ashy notes. Full body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Pours black with a thin almond head, clingy, nice lacing present. Nose is all coffee, notes of roast, vanilla and creamer. Taste is nearly identical; this is a coffee bomb wrapped in espresso and dropped into a vat of pure vanilla extract. Great dessert beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Pours pitch black with nougat colored one finger high head. Aroma; Loads of cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt and espresso coffee.Taste; Espresso coffee, cocoa, roasted malt and vanilla. Well balanced porter, thick and tasteful.

Bottleshare with bratchris - Wow, aroma comes forward heavily with huge madagascar-vanilla, coffee with a huge roasted character. Flavor has panacotta, chocolate with vanillasauce. Dry finish. Extremely well crafted porter.

Flaska på Bishop, Örebro. Svart med moccabrunt skum, lägger sig mestadels annat än en ring runt glaset. Rejäla espressotoner i doften med lakrits, soja och tydlig umami. Även toffee och lite torkad frukt i bakgrunden. Något större kropp, men ändå relativt lätt för stilen. Len. Espresso också i smaken tillsammans med soja och en del kola. Kaffetonerna är intensiva med en ganska fyllig syrlighet. I eftersmaken lite mer matt och len kaffebeska som sakta avtar. Hade gärna fått vara lite mer tyngd och kropp i det hela, men överlag ändå en god imperial stout. På Bishop prisvärd dessutom.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, chocolate, and coffee.

Pour is a black with a large tan head. Aroma is a nice roasted malt, some nuttiness from the coffee and that vanilla is pure bliss. Flavor is just like vanilla and coffee ice cream. Its thick and rich with different waves of the coffee and the vanilla is off the chain. A nice roast from the coffee or malt is left on the tongue and the alcohol is buried behind all the flavor components. This was a awesome beer. Not just your typical impy stout/porter the additions is what make this beer special.
Flaske. Ok øl men den smager kemisk. Vaniljen og kaffen bakker ikke op om porteren, og man har på fornemmelsen af at det ikke er rigtig vanilje. Alkoholburn til sidst. Ikke god.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 The first time I tried this was in 650ml bottle, and I thougth it was the best beer Ive ever tried, however, this rating is based upon the 355ml bottle.

I dont know why the differences between the two tastings were so big. The sweet taste that the vanilla added in the 650ml bottle was gone. Now the taste is full of bitter coffe. Dont get me wrong, this beer is still great, but it feels like something is amiss. Did they change the recipe? Another type of coffee maybe? Finish is a bit too bitter.

Otherwise it is still great. Heavy roasted malt base with chocolate, coffee and a hint of vanilla. Long finish. Warming, beautiful Imperial Porter.

Pours jet black with a solid 2.5 fingers of khaki head. Great aroma of caramelised coffee bean sweets, burnt sugar, wet wool and deep malty, roasted cereal core coming through on the back of the nose. The palate is medium+ bodied and very well balanced. Not at all too sweet or candied, but with almost a hint of tartness coming through on the early finish which continues on bitter notes on a malty background. Very nice.

Black pour, big beige head. Aroma is very acidic, very roasty coffee with a sweet vanilla nose. Mouthfeel is oily, and slightly thick, with a soft carb. Finish is all super dark, and almost burnt malts. Big roasty notes, loads of cocoa and vanilla and very acidic espresso coffee. Pretty impressive Porter.
On nitro at the brewery. Awesome. Almost an Irish cream creaminess to it. Smooth, coffee, toasted toffee, vanilla. Epic.

Bottle 65cl.
@ Central Liquor & Deli, Coronado, USA.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, slightly bitter and spicy.

A black beer with a small brown head. Aroma is ot roasted coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt and milk. Taste is bitter with a double dark coffee aftertaste. Faint carbonation and some astringency. Kind of oily, but very drinkable. Very complex with a strong aftertaste full of character. An imperial porter indeed.

Bottle at King Arthur, Ciampino-Italy. Deep dark brown, decent ivory foam. Nose: dark chocolate, grounded chocolate, blast of vanilla! Mouth: vanilla, cake, a bit bitter!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with a large frothy tan head that lasts. Looks like a root beer float. Strong coffee smell, like an iced coffee from one of those fluff coffee shops. Nice smooth taste, with very little bitterness. Much better than expected. It seems Ballast Point actually can resist the temptation to over-hop one of their brews. Thick feel despite the carbonation. This is a good Porter.
Quite simply the best overall porter you will ever consume. Shear ecstasy for the palate.

Bottle from trade with Henrik - thank you! The beer has got a deep black colour with a steady and smooth head and a smooth body. Delicious aroma of chocolate, coffee and malt. Taste of bittersweet chocolate, strong coffee, malt, barrel and dark bread. Intense and strong finish. Great beer.
355 ml bottle from Systembolaget web. Black with tanned head. Roasted malt, bitter coffee and light sweer vanilla. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
Vanilla and coffee flavor really stands out. Yummmmm. The downside is that the flavor tastes a bit artificial.

Très axée sur la vanille, cest un dessert sucré et cochon. Un alcool magnifiquement caché et une buvabilité assez épeurante. Pas une bière extrêmement complexe, cest au bout du compte comme un cupcake quon mange sans trop se poser de question.
Smell and taste of coffee, cacao, vanilla. Taste also malt, slightly sour, right bitterness. Right texture. Very good beer, just hope it less of vanilla.

22 fl oz bottle, bought at the brewery. My 100th US beer on RB. Nearly black, only reddish edges. More than one finger beige head. Strong coffee on the nose. Taste starts also with strong coffee. In the middle part some low sweetness, little bit vanilla. Increasing alcoholic. Malt in the background. Warming. Strong stuff.

Bottle. Black body with brown head. Aroma is coffee chocolate dried fruit and some vanilla. Taste is also coffee, vanilla with some roasted malts. Aftertaste is nice bitter perfect balanced by some malty sweetness. Very nice one.
Dark black color with thin light brown ring of a head an little lacing. Aroma and flavor have deep chocolatey, cocoa, coffee and vanilla notes. Very smooth but bold, and tasty!
Nice deep dark almost jet black body. Espresso, chocolate and roasted malts in the aroma, with some essence of hops. Taste is of coffee, roasted malt and chocolate.

(Ballast Point Victory at Sea) 650 ml bottle at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10%, bottled Dec. 5 2013
Totally black colour on the body with two fingers of thick, brown head on top, with very good retention.
The coffee aroma is still strong, so is the vanilla, faint roasted malts, but actually coffee at first and vanilla right afterwards dominate the aroma.
Taste has also lots and lots of vanilla, cold coffee, coffee grounds, roasted malts more noteble now, the alcohol pretty well hidden.
Medium body with good carbonation, nicely dry on the palate.
Very good and amazingly easy to drink.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Love the vanilla coffee that doesnt taste like vanilla or coffee, but much deeper. This is an instant favorite for me.

From the MacBoost rotter. Dark pour with tan head. Coffee and vanilla hit the nose, some roasted malts, and bread. Taste is a robust coffee/vanilla flavor, very slight bitterness and zero detection of alcohol. Medium mouthful. Great beer served to the masses. Would recommend to others.

Mörk malt, rostad malt, kaffe, choklad, salt?, lagom beska. Tyvärr lite mycket alkohol i doft och smak - ska testa lagra nån flaska och se om de blir bättre.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bot. First I hesitated at 12 midnight to drink this then I blew the cork. Big black gentle pour. First taste evolves to be quite rude nasty bitter and volatile. Yes, its a masterpiece alright, a big in yer face masterpiece of a high alky ass kicking boozy beer. Its a blowhard black beer. Reminds me in many respects to a boozy high alky black ipa, yeah. Same with finish, perhaps this would age well. Yeash a little aging may round out this bullshit imperial black ipa bullshit...... oh, I almost forgot, since its such a dizzying beer, theres coffee in thar 2! heheheh
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 oz bottle. Pours black with a full bubbly natural tan head. Aromas of coffee, minerals, and roasted malts. Flavors of chocolate, dark caramel , acidic coffee, and mild roasted malts. Nicely balanced. Smooth and very good!

Didnt care much for the peppermint seasonal version this past winter - too much going on. And, getting burned out on coffee flavored stouts and porters. But... this is pretty good stuff. Pours very dark with minimal tan head. Aroma is that of an espresso bean wrapped in a vanilla pod. Flavor is similar with more sweet vanilla both complementing the roasty toastedness This is extremely smooth mouthfeel and slightly sweet finish.

Dark with mahogany edges, beautifully textured beige head that lingered thin on top. Big aroma, chocolate, vanilla, mint, roasted malts....rolled nicely over the tongue. Came together nicely, taste of a chocolate frango, pleasant finish, small notes of Kahlua. Turned breadier with warmth. Excellent.

330ml from systembolaget. Pitch black with Brown head. More carbonation than in a regular Aroma of coffee, vanilla, malts. Taste is coffee, vanilla, dark malts, hints of coconut. Some bitterness in the finish, which is the only negative side of this porter!

Deeper clouded black-brown, darker tan head. Pretty aggressively, upfront roasted espresso notes, some darker fruit notes, maybe a little bit of honey and vanilla. Decently bitter upfront, quite sweet. Heavier body, very chewy, a good bit of oiliness. Long finish. Pretty good, the coffee is not super well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Dark brown pour. Aroma is vanilla, coffee, chocolate, and caramel. Taste has some toasted malts with the coffee really coming through in the finish. Nice balance with everything. Really nice.

Servide en Snifter.

APARIENCIA: de color negro más no completamente ya que se observan algunos destellos marrones y rojizos a contraluz; corona de espuma color beige de poca retención, de burbuja compacta y buen lacing en copa.

AROMA: chocolate semiamargo, vainilla que aporta cierto dulzor al aroma, café tostado, cacao.

SABOR: chocolate semiamargo, vainilla, café tostado y granos de cacao es lo que se percibe, queda cierto gusto chocolatoso semiamargo y dulce que no empalaga, y algo licorosa que no llega a molestar. El retrogusto quedo un amargor moderado bajo, nada molesto, y una sensación licorosa y cálida en garganta que tampoco es agresiva.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo moderado ligero de baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: una buena cerveza donde se destacan los adjuntos sin embargo no opacan a la cerveza más bien se complementan. Excelente como postre.

Aroma is vanilla ,chocolate, mocha and toffee. Taste is rich malts, caramel, toffee and vanilla. Very light tartiness on tip but overall very well balanced. Light clove and coffee notes. Appearance is black with a medium beige head that retains fairly well.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond shop. Brown black color with a huge tan head. Aroma of espresso, cocoa, mocha, dark chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt. Flavor of sweet malt, dark chocolate, tons of black coffee, licorice, vanilla, bitter roasty finish. Medium-full bodied, smooth and oily palate. Great brew.

Aroma: Light vanilla
Appearance: Thinner head than I expected, deep, muddy 
Taste: mocha, still searching for the vanilla, BOLD roasted coffee
Palate: mouthy, thick-ish, but not overwhelmingly so
Overall: Very nice, but not quite as good as I expected, given the comments. The roasted coffee flavor dominated this one and I definitely got more of a mocha flavor than vanilla here. Still, a strong dark beer.

Coffee and vanilla imperial porter. Aroma of vanilla and coffee is awesome. Black as can be in color. Brown lacy head. Easy drinking imperial porter. Incredible flavor. Will drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. Opaque brown with brownish head. The aroma has lots of coffee, vanilla, creamy with roasted malt. Bitterish and sweetish flavor with lots of coffee, coffee beans, vanilla, milk chocolate, a bit "green", lingering coffee bitterness. Full-bodied. Great.
Bottle split two ways. Pitch black pour with a frothy espresso head. Loads of milky chocolate, light roast, caramel, vanilla, freshly roasted coffee and some light honey. Super smooth!
On bottle. Aroma of coffee and cacao. Nice dark color with consistent head. Taste of coffee and slightly to vanilla. Very consistent. Good one

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Bouteille, dégustée le 9/13/2013. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : brune très foncée. 
Apparence : opaque. 


Arôme :  
Malt rôti, chocolat, moyen de café et de vanille, notes de mélasse brûlée. 


Goût :  
En entrée de bouche : Moyen goût de vanille avec des notes de chocolat au lait. 
Une dominante amère de malt rôti (voire brûlé, de café noir et de chocolat noir est présente avec des notes de houblon herbeux ainsi que des traces de sucre brûlé.


En bouche :  

Corps : moyenne.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : riche et crémeuse.
Finale : longue, composée dun moyenne amertume de rôti, de café, avec des notes de chocolat, dalcool et de houblon herbeux.

Pour is a dark forbidden coloring with a light but creamy head. Smell is black coffee, roast, sweet caramel and burnt sugar. Extremely nice mouth feel, very creamy and perfect for drinking slow or fast. Coffee balanced with caramel and salt, some spice is hiding in there and some interesting vanilla subnotes. Extremely good.

Id wager that its impossible not to be impressed by this beer -- its just such a full-on assault on your senses that you dont even have a choice. Its big, complex, and chewy, and its loaded with coffee and roasted grain flavor. Its boozy and intoxicating without being hot or harsh. I know that Ballast Point sold out and all of that, but cmon -- this beer deserves its reputation.

Brilliant. Opaque brown/black with towering cappuccino colored head. Memorizing cascades as the co2 releases during pour. Head flows over like coffee whipped cream. Aroma of coffee ice cream, vanilla bean, chocolate nibs, toffee, some dried fruit. Taste is aroma x 10. Delicious. Needs to warm from fridge to let flavor shine. Long bittering finish thats not too dry. Seems more like dark chocolate than hops bittering. Just wonderful. Id love to see Victory and Ballast Point merge this and Stormking Stout as a collab.
12 oz bottle- nice head on the pour. Slightly acrid coffee smell with hint of vanilla. Hefty coffee and can feel the 10% abv. Not much malty sweetness but good like that dark chocolate bar.

bottle @ home. Cellared 2,5 years. Almost black with a beige to brown head. Considering the age it has retained a very fresh coffee character in both aroma and taste. Aroma is complex, medium roasted with dark fruits, vanilla, milk chocolate, coffee, vinous raisins, warming booze, oak and some caramel and herbs. Sweet yet quite dry taste with a dry coffee roast and booze finish that clashes somewhat with the stong grape bitterness. Flavors of subtle vanilla, toffee, dark chocolate, raisins, some plum and red fruits, leather, booze. Lingering vanilla, char. Has aged very well.

12oz bottle into pint glass. Very dark brown, almost black. Dark beige head, big bubbles. Vanilla coffee nose. More astringent than I expect from a porter in the mouth. The alcohol peeks through a bit. On the swallow, the malts and richness briefly pops out, before fading into vanilla and a bit of brown sugar. Think Id like it more if the alcohol were dialed back a touch and the coffee didnt taste quite so much like Satrbucks usual burnt offerings.
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours black with an off white head. Massive chocolate vanilla aroma. Dry bitter chocolate finish. Super nice.
Bold coffee aroma. Black body with a soap bubble-like tan head. A prominent coffee flavored taste. The vanilla is subtle and balances the coffee well.

22 oz bomber purchased from Habits cig and booze shop in Salem OR
$7.99
Darkest brown coloured ale with a very attractive thick and creamy tan coloured head.
Aromas of creamy coffee ( if thats even possible)..infused with vanilla..and toasted malts..excellent.
Taste the same creamy darker roast coffee..followed by vanilla ice cream and finishes with sea salt dark chocolate bitterness.
Nice thick and luscious mouth feel..batter after taste and a touch of alcohol.
Very very good porter.

12 oz bottle into a snifter. Pours a cola brown with a small tan head. Strong, slightly bitter coffee up front with chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, and a little bit of hops on the backend. Long finish of roasted malts and coffee. Full body, slightly creamy texture, moderate carbonation. Definitely really good, but ultimately not really any better than most other coffee porters or stouts on the market. Not enough to justify the $15.99 price for a 6-pack that is being charged here locally.
Solid coffee aroma with a smoky body with bold vanilla. Finish is sweet with plums and rasin.
Aroma of coffee, taste is more coffee, vanilla, silky smooth, nice finish, great beer!
Sample @ PGH Beerfest. Medium body of dark brown. Nice aroma of malts, coffee, and nuts. Rich creamy body. Decent flavored Porter. Good but not great.

Very good. Heavy in alcohol at 10% but has a solid coffee and vanilla flavor. Minimal brown head. Pours dark (surprise)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is coffee. Taste is coffee with just some bitterness. Overall really solid.

Best imperial porter/stout I've had by a ton. Beautiful aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Still trying to get the coffee aroma out of beer since coffee is my other hobby, just don't smell or taste it. Taste is delicious and smooth chocolate and vanilla. No alcohol evident despite being a huge beer. This beer is amazing and can't wait to try it again. I'm an IPA guy and this beer may have converted me to a porter/stout lover. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Love this brew. Silky smooth with hint of vanilla. Just enough viscosity to be creamy and roll around jaw real nicely. A real nice strong porter coffee trace. BP's such a great brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Poured a dark brown color with a small head and some lacing. Aroma of fresh roasted coffee, malts and vanilla. Taste of roasted malts, fresh coffee with some vanilla and bit of spice in the background. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. Fairly full body and very nicely crafted. 10% ABV well hidden.
A peppery aroma, with hints of vanilla, and coffee. Pours a dark brown color with a foamy tan head. Taste of vanilla, coffee and a hint of pepper. Creamy feel with a a bitter espresso feel.

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, medium off white color. Medium pepper and burnt malt aroma. Full body with a creamy slightly burnt malt flavor and light bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle. Dark black appearance. Good head and lacing. Great aroma, pepper spices with vanilla.
Tailspin beerfest. Tailspin beerfest tailspin beerfest tailspin beerfest tailspin beerfest

Poured from a 12 oz bottle on 02.17.16. A: Lots of dark coffee. It overwhelms anything else. A: 1 finger tan head that fades to a thin layer of fluff. Midnight black body. T: Dark coffee with artificial vanilla on the back end. P: Thin. O: This is a one sip quitter for me. The coffee is crazy strong and the icky sweet vanilla flavor doesnt do much for balance. I dont understand the hype over this one.

"Imperial porter" is a strange way of saying "stout," but what theyre really getting at is that this is a predominately roasty but not sweet beer. The 10% alcohol slips by and had me fooled for a regular strength porter. Creamy mouthfeel. The coffee and vanilla appear and blend towards the end without seeming gimmicky or overdone. Earthy, spicy hop bitterness. Some instant vanilla coffee in the aftertaste detracts. Top notch for a 6-8 oz pour.

Beautiful and black with a reluctant toffee brown head that, as far as it goes, lingers.

Aroma of (you guessed it) coffee and vanilla with maybe a background note of light cinnamon.

Rich, smooth mouthfeel characteristic of a wonderful porter. Retains a hint of coffee bitterness. Coffee and vanilla in balance with toasted malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Phenomenal porter. Aroma is strong vanilla and coffee bean. Great mouthfeel with an awesome balance of malt, vanilla, and coffee bean. Not roasted, rather green bean.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Huge roasted coffee and chocolate flavors! Slight bitter aftertaste. Perfect for a cold winter afternoon.

Soft Milk chocolate aroma, a Lot of cocoa, coffee too. Hint of cinammon, so sweet and elegante aroma. Pour black with rocky head, beige. Strong coffee notes, sweet caramel, sweet chocolate, infinite aftertaste of vanilla. Very Well balanced, silky mouthfeel, you can find coffee and vanilla, in the same moments, for a very inique flavours. A little Kick of alcool but not boozy. Smooth, very smooth, velvety confidence on the tongue. A great, bug beer for ballast point.

Shared a bottle. Jet black in the glass. Direct sunlight didnt penetrate this. Lofty caramel head. Nose is all about the coffee. Sweet smelling with some milk chocolate. First taste is coffee, cacao, roasted malt, sweet but not overly. Warming boozy finish in the belly. Very smoothly balanced and tasty malts. Well done.

Poured from 12oz longneck bottle into a snifter goblet, opaque dark brown colour, reddish when held to the light, with beige foam, short-lived but lots of lace. Exactly what youd expect from an Imperial Porter with Coffee and Vanilla: roasty, toasty, boozy, hop resin, stone fruit esters, etc. I live the grainbill and coffee aspects okay, but the vanilla is too strong for my taste, and its a bit too acidic and alcoholic to consider truly balanced. Full-bodied, moderate carbonation, strong bittersweet aftertaste which remains over-powered by vanilla to the end. Worsened as it warmed. Intense, ballsy, I get why people love it so but Im sure Id enjoy the base porter at a tamer abv more.

12 oz bottle poured to wine glass, enjoyed with cheese, mixed nuts, crackers
Appearance: dark brown to black appearance in wine glass, deep brownish red color is viewed against the light, minimal head
Aroma: strong green coffee bean smell, not like brewing coffee, vanilla is not noticeable
Taste: Toasted malt taste, with hint of coffee, dominant lingering alcohol afterwards
Overall: Excellent beer, one of the best porters i have had
Very nice brew. Has a nice dark malt aroma. Is a creamy body. Has a hooch chocolate and coffee taste with some toast malt.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka foncée riche et crémeuse laissant une superbe dentelle. Arôme de vanille, café froid, malt torréfié. Goût de café, vanille, malt torréfié, bonne amertume, alcool, chocolat noir en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

12oz bottle from Prairie Trail Hy-Vee, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Aromas of roasted malts and medium-roast coffee and coffee grounds masking undertones of vanilla bean and something curious like wet cement. Massive creamy, bubbly head to match or even surpass a perfectly poured pint of Guinness, dissolving quickly into generous lacing. Short-lived effervescence on the glass. Significantly roastier flavor than aroma, dark-roast coffee and dark chocolate up front, roasty malted barley in the middle with lingering chocolate bitterness and vanilla bean on the finish. Full-bodied and creamy, to all outward appearances the carbonation should be more than sufficient, but the mouthfeel still seems heavy and flat for this type of beer. Would benefit from more carbonation or more vanilla. A nice looking beer and fairly textbook example of a roasty stout. Doesnt seem as special or unique as its score here had me expecting, and doesnt benefit from the addition of the vanilla beans as several other brews Ive reviewed lately. At least the price is competitive.
Great coffee flavor! Like it a lot! Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

650ml bottle from Brewdog online shop:
An excellent imperial porter with a strong alcohol kick & lots of flavour, particularly at the end when a warming alcohol kick came through. Well-balanced with nice coffee & vanilla flavours on top of the dark malts & roasted flavours, it was an outstanding beer & one of the better porters Ive tried so far, although Orkney Porter probably still comes out on top.
Great dark beer with a nice head. The beer is smooth and very flavorful, but no hoppy bitterness.

Svart med ett litet gult skum. Trevlig doft med rostade toner och kallt kaffe. Bra len smak, vaniljen och kaffet ger en fin känsla. Lätt trots hög alkohol, bra porter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottled - great portery aroma. Super dark in color. Nice roasty porter flavor, rich with a hint of vanilla.

Tap pour Malt & Vine, Redmond WA. Dark brownish beer, off-white/tan head. Beautiful vanilla ice cream aroma. Flavors are delicious, a mix of roasted barley with a good bit of dark fruity sweetness, and a moderately carbonated and bitter finish. I really like how the aromas are so strongly vanilla while the flavors are predominantly straight up roasted barley, the way a great porter should be.  Pretty excellent.

Excellent brew. Very dark brown almost black coffee color with a nice foam head that is tannish orange. The aroma is strong coffee and rye bread with a subtle hoppy whiff. The initial taste is hoppy coffee with a pleasant bitter bite. As it sits in the mouth it gets smooth with a barely sweet toffee taste mixed with dark malt and hops with vanilla espresso. Its complex with different taste, but they mingle exceptionally well. The aftertaste returns to a more bitter roasted hop essence with a tinge of creamed coffee. At 10% ABV, the 12 oz size is perfect for slow sipping on a winter day.
Im impressed. I thought Ballast Point was just about their hoppy beers, but this one is so well made and balanced. Sampled it to get a base test for two other variations, and it didnt disappoint.

Bottle shared. RIch vanilla cream, dark chocolate, coffee beans, orea, silky mouthfeel, smooth finish with a gentle sweet edge. Outstanding imperial porter, vanilla really shines, dangerously drinkable and heady.

Deep brown to black pour with an inch of fluffy khaki head. Bright caramel-y rich dark roast coffee aroma, hazelnut, vanilla, a bit boozy. Soft carbonation, creamy smooth mouthfeel, dry effervescent finish. Very bold rich toffee hazelnut coffee flavor, bitter but smooth. Really great big beer that doesnt taste too big.
Tap at Spring Street bar, LA. Stout pour. A: light coffee note, light stout. T: follows aroma, with bitter coffee development, Rucola. Sweet aftertaste, vanilla.
Dark pour from bottle. Creamy head. Notes of coffee and vanilla. Creamy with a bit of alcohol sting. Lovely.

Poured from a bottle. Black with a medium sized khaki head. Decent amount of lacing. Strong coffee aroma. Initial coffee taste finishing with a dark chocolate bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My best imperial porter. Some say the vanilla aroma is too strong and artificial, but thats why I like this beer. The vanilla and coffee aroma is just amazing. A little bit sweet and bitterness balances it. A little bit boozy when you drink half bottle of this.

A tall khaki head with rhythmic lacing and stealthy alcohol wall crowning a black body 

Big aromatic coffee meets silky smooth dark chocolate with accents of chocolate chip cookies, bubblegum, and subtle floral and citrus on an exceptionally smooth, cohesive, lightly creamy medium body leading to residuals with heightened flowers and branches... distinct characteristics with medium complexity, vibrant medium intensity, fresher bottles definitely had fuller coffee notes aromatically, but this age still provides full coffee flavors

12 oz bottle code VAS 79 15328 13:50 from late fall Kansas re-rollout

Pours black with a brown head. Nose is strong coffee and cream with a touch of hops. Flavor is a burst of chocolate and coffee with a relatively long and sweet finish. alcohol is well hidden. very good beer.

Poured from a bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Smell is great and develops as the beer warms. Started with mostly roasty coffee aromas, followed by vanilla sweetness and some warmth, then more smokiness. Flavor has coffee notes throughout with some light sweetness that border on vanilla. Finish has some dark chocolatey bitterness. The ABV doesnt come through in the flavor. Mouth feel is lighter than I thought, but medium-heavy with low carbonation. Overall an excellent porter that develops nicely as it warms.

dark brown, coffee-like colour, medium sized creamy beige-brown head; aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla, some liqueur, maybe herbal notes, too; taste is the same with slight roasted bitter dominance over the vanilla and chocolate; amazing imperial porter!

On tap at Llewelyns St. Charles. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was sweet with roasted malts, some coffee, chocolate and cocoa. The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, coffee, chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Quite tasty.

Sharing session thanks to Tibor from Brewdog. Dark black pour with a mocha head. Coffee chocolate nose. Big coffee bitterness that goes through the whole thing. Very drinkable. Nice feel. Some sharp carb feels.

L: poured into a tulip snifter it looks almost black, tightly-packed carbonation that forms an almost creamy tan head that sticks around. Great lacing. 
S: milk coffee aroma, creamer, roasted malt, a hint of vanilla that grows over time. 
T: the taste is sensational. Rich dark bitter chocolate, black coffee bitterness, malt, toffee. So much fuller than the nose let on. Strong bitter end, just how I like my coffee and imperial black beers. 
F: full-bodied, nice gentle carbonation, lingering roasted malt, did I say bitter? It balances out the sweetness really well. 
O: I loved it the first time, this time even more. Delicious, strong porter.
Dark pour with small brown head. Nose of coffee, chocolate and hint of vanilla. Flavor is much the same, with coffee taking charge. Nice body with a touch of tobacco and smoke on the finish.

Rating #1519 - 18.03.2015 - 650mL Bottle from Palm Liquor. Pours jet black with a luxurious velvety tan head with excellent retention. Aroma is heavy on vanilla, dark roast coffee, toffee, burnt sugar notes. Coffee flavours throughout, accented by vanilla bean, caramel and brown sugar notes. Exquisite.

On tap in LA. Coffee aroma is very strong in this rich imperial porter, the vanilla is subtle. Sweet but not cloying, very nice (I think I actually preferred the Rip Current take on it). Great coffee imperial porter.

Really a very good beer. Im not normally a fan of vanilla beer, and porter is not my favorite style, and I usually avoid the over 8% beers... that said, this will surely be a standard exception to those rules. Impressive. At the price and potency, however, will probably be an occasional treat rather than a go-to.

Bottle at home. Aroma is dark malt, lots of vanilla beans, tons of chocolate, mocha, coffee, chocolate milk, dessert, roast, hint of peat, some coal. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with some nice roasty bitterness in the finish. Body is full and thick. You wouldnt guess this has an ABV of 10%, its that smooth and drinkable. Incredible beer, a total chocolate vanilla coffee dessert Porter, approaching Porter perfection for my taste.
Well this is a special one...pulled my ratebeer app out of hibernation... Dark pour coffee chocolate joy...love
Excellent big porter. Dark brown with a thick foamy tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is roasty, bitter, coffee, vanilla, and hint of booze. Full body.
12 oz bottle. Pours very deep brown to black with a tan head. Roasted coffee aroma. Cocoa cream and coffee flavor, roasty and rich. Really good stuff.

660ml bottle (thanks Mart). Almost black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Roast, coffee, black pepper, chilly, vanilla and very tiny bit of alcohol in aroma. Vanilla, roast, woody, caramel, pepper, oily in taste. Complex aftertaste involves coffee, vanilla and roast. Nice full body. Nice balance. Fantastic brew. More!?

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is pitch black with a thick tan head. The aroma is full of vanilla, coffee and malt. The flavor is an excellent blend of malt and vanilla with distinct coffee mixed in. This is a really good porter, a must try for any beer fan.

12 fl oz bottle via Piscator34. Pours a virtually opaque brown with a large brown head. Aromas of cocoa, licorice, and booze. Tastes are dry bitter cocoa, vanilla, and licorice. Boozy warmth, big body, chalky, short finish. Nice beverage for an imperial. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottle (from firma bier). Pours black with beige head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is intense coffee, roast, sweetness, vanilla, peppery notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, vanilla, roast, malt, dark chocolate, black pepper. Finish is intense coffee bitter with some alcohol. Overall: great brew.

Opaque black beer, small brown head. Nose is stale coffee, vanilla, roast, chocolate notes, notes of black pepper, some alcohol. Flavor is roast, black pepper, chocolate, smooth vanilla and caramel in the finish with and alcoholic notes. Lingering roast, coffee and vanilla, some chocolate. Begins roasty and heavy with pepper, finishes with caramel and coffee. A shapeshifter and a sipper.

Pours a jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, and chocolate. Flavor is bitter chocolate, coffee, and subtle vanilla. Has a thinner body than Id expect out of such a big beer, and the bitterness is a bit harsh. I like it though.

Bottled. A black beer, tanned creamy head. Strong chocolate truffle nose with petfumy vanilla and cold coffee. A hint of earthiness on the background. Rich, sweetish/syrupy maltiness, lots of vanilla, rasins, molasses. Bitterish vanilla effect gets stronger when warm. Finish is drier with quite strong, clean bitterness and cold coffee. Lingering bitter chocolate flavor and some surprisigly nectary fruits. Slight alcohol warmth. Very drinkable. Thick, slightly oily and silky texture. Almost full body, soft carbs.

12 oz bottle. Pours black with a full bubbly natural tan head. Aromas of coffee, minerals, salty nuts, and roasted malts. Flavors of chocolate, dark caramel , acidic coffee, and mild roasted malts. Nicely balanced. Smooth
Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, dark chocolates and roast. Taste follows, great coffee presence but not overpowering.
Pours a deep dark brown, khaki colored head. Aroma of cold coffee, flavor throws in some sassafrass and licorice notes. Not picking up on much vanilla. Sweet upfront, bitter out back. Good beer.
Pours a black color with a brown head. Sticky lacing. A chocolate, vanilla, licorice and roast aroma. Rich, malty coffee and vanilla. An almost burnt grain bitterness in the finish.
Bottle. Black colour with brown head. Coffee, licorice, roasted, vanilla aroma. Sweet, coffee, licorice, vanilla, roasted, wood taste. Medium to full body.
Dark body with a thin beige head. Rich malty taste and I got the vanilla later. This one is a real gem.
12 oz bottle. Thick, creamy, good mouthfeel. Coffee definitely more prominent than the vanilla, which is faint. Solid beer.
