Appealing aroma with chocolate and red berries. Rich flavor with cream, chocolate, vanilla, oak and coffee. Full body, medium-high carbonation. Beautiful.

Aroma is coffee, vanilla, chocolate, very bready, dry, real good. Appearance is dark dark brown, light tan head, thick. Taste is great. Vanilla, coffee, roasted malt, a touch of booze, chocolate, bready, wow. Mouthfeel is thick, medium to heavy body with soft carbonation. Overall, my god. I?m so pleased that Ballast Point is finally gracing my presence in Michigan.

650ml bottle pours black in color with a huge light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is coffee, chocolate with vanilla and light roasted grains. Taste is a chocolate malty sweetness with a coffee and light roasted grain bitterness with some caramel and vanilla throughout. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, this is a very well crafted brew that is an excellent example of the style, highly recommended.

Pours black with a moderate khaki head. Aroma is Fresh roasted coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Smells like really good fudge. Taste of fresh coffee, chocolate, and vanilla. Once again, reminds me of really good fudge. Medium/full bodied with moderate carbonation. At 10 percent abv the alcohol is well hidden in the coffee and vanilla sweetness. Creamy/oily mouthfeel with a fantastic lingering bitter finish. The coffee takes center stage for me on this one.  Whatever coffee they used to brew this is fantastic. The value of this beer is outstanding.
Pik zwart met een beige kraag. Ruikt chocolade, cacao, geroosterd, koffie. Smaakt chocolade, zacht, vanille, geroosterd. Heerlijk.
Pikzwart met een goede kraag. Ruikt vol koffie, bitter, gebrand, vanille, pure chocolade. Smaakt vol, vanille, koffie, chocolade. Zachte bittere afdronk.
Quality porter, or IMO, a stout. However, all coffee and vanilla and too little roast aroma and taste.

My first to have in Michigan. Its good to have them here. On tap at The Oak. Dark black pour with a mocha head. Coffee chocolate nose. Big coffee bitterness that goes through the whole thing. Very drinkable. Nice feel. Some sharp carb feels. Good stuff.

Bottle; pours black with a mocha colored head; roasted coffee aroma with hints of vanilla, chocolate, and malt; taste is roasted coffee with chocolate, vanilla, and malt; finish is dry, roasted coffee and malt with a touch of bitterness; wow, excellent imperial porter

Where and how:  on tap at Birch 
Aroma: bold, heavy with chocolate, alcohol and vanilla. Mild residue of heat coming from its alcohol. More of late chocolate
 Appearance : 
Top: small and white.
Base: black, almost opaque
Palate :  full bodied, smooth with light carbonation.
Taste: very nice blend of cask and dry heat adds to dimension. Last soft chocolate (semi-dark).
 other notes  solid, very nice.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. Deep dark brown pour under a fluffy tan head. Vibrant aroma of vanilla, spent coffee grinds, and vague fruit character. The body is smooth and medium. Coffee and caramel sweetness in the flavor with a full bitterness that lingers briefly at the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Damp concrete roadt nose. Black super glossy appearance with light loose light tan head.
Deep sappy slick body. Bitter dark chocolate & coffee with traces of ash and restrained liquorice. Some acidity. Light vanilla.The bitterness leaves a very long lingering black coating in the roof of your mouth. Stealthily huge but still linear.
Pours black with tan head.  Heavy body.  Tons of coffee, hints of vanilla, caramel and chocolate.  Huge coffee and dark chocolate bitterness throughout.

A dark crimson pour with generous head and visible carbonation. Huge vanilla smell, together with coffee, chocolate, cocoa and caramel. The taste is quite complex and perfectly balanced, with vanilla up front, followed by coffee, alcohol spiciness and malt sweetness blended together with a soft bitterness. The soft carbonation makes for a very nice mouth-feel. Medium-dry finish with a strong vanilla feel that lasts on the palate. One of the best porters around, and I am quite picky about my porters.
Bottle at Cosmic Comic Cafe. Lots of chocolate and coffee. Also vanilla and sweet roasted malts. Moderate bitterness and sweetness. Dry and bitter finish. Excellent!

Pours black with a light brown medium head. Head retention is good. AROMA: dark roasted malt, vanilla, blond coffee, smoky, dark bitter chocolate oil, burned brown sugar, peppercorn, slight alcohol, caramel, earthy, faint toffee, spices licorice, herbs and slight tobacco. TASTE: dark roasted malt, vanilla, blond coffee, peppercorn, smoky, dark bitter chocolate oil, spices burned brown sugar, slight alcohol, hop spice, molasses, tangy, caramel, earthy, faint toffee, licorice, herbs, faint chili pepper and slight tobacco. AFTER TASTE: bitter malt, peppercorn, burned brown sugar, bitter coffee oil and herbs with an oily spiced finish.

Served on tap at the Beer Market in Vernon Hills. Arrived in a snifter. Very dark black, oily liquid with a deep, low, dense tan head. Aroma has a strong coffee nose with hefty chocolate and toasted malt notes. Flavor is extremely complex with a very early coffee flavor but it is quickly combined with a sweet chocolate, smooth toasted maltiness and with a smooth vanilla/ice cream finish. Body is very oily and extremely hefty. Overall one of the better beers I have had in a long time. Very well crafted and worth the time to find.
Bomber bottle, thanks to Bytemesis, poured like motor oil. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, and booze. Flavor is silky vanilla cocoa. I want some more.

Pours black, small grey head. Smell is oat, chocolate, mildly bitter. Taste is intense, dark malts , sweet, chocolate (intense) . Some vanilla notes almost. Very complex, and intense, yet balanced out completely. I absolutely love everything about this beer. Perfect MF and carbo. NIce !

A nice oil slick of a treat! Ive tried this multiple times, but only rating now for some reason. It is not quite exceptional, but the combo of sweet malts and acidic, dry coffee roast do blend together nicely. At the finish, the vanilla hits pretty hard! It is noticeable, it is not a cheap afterthought! Very happy to try, again. 220z bomber
bomber bottle from neighbor Bob - thanks! Perfect in every sense of the word. Shared with three friends who all agreed. One point off for Wabi Sabi.

650ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Pours black in colour with a foamy beige head leaving alittle lacing and aroma of coffee beans, vanilla, roasted, smoke and chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, roast malt, toffee, molasses, coffee, vanilla, with booze and grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry spicy roasted malt finish. Very drinkable.
Black beer with smallish beige head. Aroma has vanilla, roasted malts, whiskey. Sweet vanilla, dark chocolate and some wooden note in the taste. Full oily body, low carbonation.
Spectacular ale - so easy to drink - total pleasure - need more - another brilliant BP beer.

Keg pour at NH Brewfest. Appearance is opaque black pour with 1- to 2-finger width beige head and great lacing. Aroma is strong roasted coffee. Taste is similar to aroma, similar to a chocolate covered espresso bean with more emphasis on bitter than sweet but a decent balance nonetheless. Palate is medium to heavy with thick texture with noticeable carbonation but not a distraction. Overall, this is really fantastic.
Deep brown, small tan head.Great vanilla/coffee nose.Palate of alcohol & vanilla with vague coffee. Slightly vinous

Yummy beer. Pours a purely opaque, oily black with a thin tan head. The nose is rich, coffee and vanilla notes wafting off the nose with a bit of heat and a light roasted bitterness. Nice and smooth with a huge complex profile.

Bottle, 10%. Black with tiny brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, little liquorice with notes of alcohol. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquroice, espresso, hop, little vegetable, oak, medium sweet, notes of alcohol and bitter.

12 oz bottle to snifter, dark brown mostly opaque pour with thick creamy diminishing tan head with minimal lacing, smells of vanilla and coffee, not overly roasted, good balance as = not too much coffee, texture is not too heavy, tiny but lively carbonation, alcohol comes through, overall I enjoyed on this first colder fall day

Very dark brown with Lacy rimming tan head; aroma is very rich roasty malt hint of coffee; flava is amazingly complex blend of fruit cherry vanilla alcohol licorice then coffee; feels medium slight fizz; finishes dry roasty malty

12oz bottles. I tried this without any idea of how it was being rated here. Im very surprised at the super-high ratings. It is interesting and a bit novel, but to me the flavors clash. The vanilla is obvious and the coffee is present, but it tastes a bit like a good porter that had vanilla added to it. I recognize the quality of the brewing process that happened here, but to me the flavors dont come together as well as I had hoped.

Bottle, 65cl. Opaque dark brown with a brown head. Sweet roasted aroma with hints of caramel, coffee, spices. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich and oily. Sweet but not overly so. Tremendous roasted and spicy character. Exquisite coffee and alcohol finish. One of the most complex and sheerly delicious beers Ive tasted.

Totally over the top porter madness, Victory at Sea is. Inhaling scents of vanilla, coffee and caramel prepares you for both the sweetness and bitterness (though far more of former than latter) and dare I say a bit of numbness from the alcohol content? Poured from a bottle.

Aroma: Clear vanilla and rich roasty malt

Appearance: Black colour and crisp creamy head, dark brown

Taste: Medium sweet of malts, medium bitter is also there, and very light sour from acid

Palate: Medium full body, creamy and oily texture, fizzy carbonation on the acid, and bitter and complex finish of aroma from vanilla and malts
Draught @ Pipes of Scotland, Uppsala. Vanilla clearly present, though not too much (foam gives hint of icecream).

Very dark cola colored beer with a frothy, brown head. Strong aromas of roasted coffee. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, some hints of raisins, and subtle notes of vanilla. Very earthy with a silky mouth feel. Bitter coffee finish. Some booze in there too. Brutal coffee brew. Tasty.
One of my favorite imperial porters ever. Elegant and thick, with the bitterness of the coffee and hops balanced with vanilla and a chocolatey malt body.

Bottle from Bier-Deluxe. Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and cocoa. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily. 170915

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 One of the Ballast Point classics, an imperial porter infused with coffee and vanilla, with a morbid yet attractive, arty label as usual with this brewery. Very creamy, lacing, tan coloured head doubting between greyish beige and light yellowish brown, very stable; colour is actually an extremely dark burgundy but looks totally opaque black in the glass. Delightful aroma: mocha, cappuccino, dark chocolate, cured meat, wet leather, dates, wet peppercorns, black olives, gingerbread, indeed vanilla but subtly so, dried grapefruit peel, hint of marmelade, cocoa, kahlua, dry sherry, sharp and stimulating accents of burnt wood, toasted bread, pipe tobacco, cinnamon, candied figs, baked banana sweetness piercing through everywhere. Candied sweet onset, raisins and dates all around, banana, but kept in place with restraining sourish and (especially) umami accents, the latter not becoming too overpowering but just adding a subtle seaweed- or mushroom-like complexity to the whole, tangy and noble, with a soft, gentle carbonation just fit for this style; vanilla sweetness suddenly pops up and accompanies the deep, thick, oily maltiness filling the mouth with well-dosed caramelly, nutty and toasted flavours before plunging into a rich and creamy chocolateness which leaves a bittersweet coating in the back of the mouth and throat, further dried by peppery, spicy, tangy hops; needless to say, a black, roasted coffee bitterness manifests itself in that phase and keeps lingering far beyond, but one can feel it is from pure coffee rather than from thick roasted barley, as would be the case in the average imperial stout. There is a glow of warming alcohol in the end, but only gently so, and for a 10% ABV beer the alcohol remains remarkably well camouflaged. An almost dame blanche-like sensation remained with me for a long time.  I need to get more Ballast Point beers: they are always right on the money. I love imperial porters and frankly, I did not expect this to be anything less than a masterpiece in its style. And they nailed it.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Bottle from SB. Very dark brown with a tiny brown head. Chocolate and roasted tones. Malt, chocolate roaasted and fruit. Full body with a roasted / fruity finish.

Noir sombre avec une petite robe marron solide. Larôme est intense. Du chocolat, café, réglisse, malt torréfié, vanille et un peu dalcool. En bouche il y a les mêmes arômes, avec une finition assez amer pour léquilibré. Super.
KØLF 060315. Black colour with a tan head. Flavour is vanilla, mocha, coffee, alcohol, chocolate, roasted malt, caramel. Full body. Balanced very nice beer.

12 oz. Pours black. Off-white head, good lacing and small head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, and mostly coffee. Flavor is... really earthy. Like dirt, dark coffee, spicy. Quite bitter, long finish. Not a really pleasant experience, but memorable and positive overall.

Plenty of vanilla dominates the nose. A bit of oak and coffee too. Orange highlights, somewhat dark, clear, not much head or lacing. Dry hefty coffee taste overwhelms. Hope you like coffee. I do. Not much else going on here. Palate is dry in an IPA sort of way.
Strong coffee Aroma, pours black with light creamy foam, Strong coffee Taste, coffee Taste lasts Long.

Pours dark reddish brown with a beige head, The aroma has chocolate, meaty hot pepper, coffee and super smooth roast - nice melding balance to all the aroma notes. It has a medium / full body with some bite and mild carbonation. The flavor starts with cacao nibs, coffee, bitter roast and spicy / earthy hops. The finish is pleasantly abrasive.
Like milk chocolate. Pepper. Vanilla. Some coffee. Seems like a stout. Tasted at my Whales and Whimps bottle share. Thx Tim.

beige head leaves lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is vanilla, molasses, roasted malts, coffee. taste like aroma, ash, tobacco, bitter chocolate long and lingering bitter aftertaste, slight alcoholheat in the end. quite dense body, medium carbonation. very taste! bottle

Bottle from a trade with Weezel. Pours a deep black, thick light mocha coloured head, leaving lots of lace. Nose is malt dominant, coffee grounds, milk chocolate, sweet, vanilla. Tastes big coffee, bitter, sweet, toffee, caramel, vanilla. Pretty awesome for a regular.
Pours dark brown with a thick light brown head. Aroma is strong dark roast coffee. Flavor is coffee, roasted malt, and a hint of dark chocolate.

650ml bottle. Pours an opaque, dark brown almost black with a large, frothy, long lasting, light brown head that laces. Strong coffee aroma with roasted malt, vanilla and dark chocolate. Sweet flavour of vanilla, caramel, liquorice and dark chocolate with a bitter coffee finish. Medium to full body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent. A world class Imperial Porter.
Bottle bough at bier-deluxe.de. Roast, coffee, lots of vanilla, chocolate and light bitterness. Awesome beer I must say, got even better after letting it rest overnight.

Bottle. Pours black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma is robust roasted chocolate malt and coffee. Roasted coffee flavor with vanilla notes. Full bodied with creamy texture and lingering roasty finish. Excellent.

The vanilla / coffee combination is not unpleasant, but it can be overpowering. This is a beer to be enjoyed once, but cannot be drunk over an evening. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pitch black with a relatively lasting coffee brown head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Similar flavours, some liquorice and dark fruits coming through. Slick oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Bottle from Chevy Chase Beer and Wine. Dark black body with thin head. Nose is liquorice, caramel. Oily taste. Nice roast and toasty. Smooth, creamy texture. Vanilla in the finish. Really nice!

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Black with tan head. Aroma is all coffee, deep roasted coffee flavours and a touch of vanilla/chocolate in the background. Taste is sweet and bitter. Medium body and prickly carbonation. Amazing stuff.
Aroma is a chocolate explosion with some roasted notes of coffee and malt, taste is thick with chocolate and vanilla, hints of coffee balance it out wonderfully fantastic!

355 ml bottle from Club de Cervezas Pours an almost jet black color with some brownish hues visible against a strong light source. Head is medium, light brown/dark tan colored, with medium retention but a fine lingering lacing. Aroma is luscious and smooth with notes of cocoa powder, oak wood, vanilla, raw coffee beans, wet earth and a touch of moccha. Not a trace of phenols with a 10% ABV, its amazing. Taste is relatively sweet, vanilla overtones with oaky and roasty bitterness. Moderate intensity but well rounded and carefully brewed. Medium body, no alcohol in the taste either. Low carbonation. Woody and dry finish. Highly sessionable and not boozy at all. Its a fine, characterful, well defined Imperial Porter, yet not the best brew by Ballast Point.

Bottle. Dark cola. Coffee grinds, roasted malt, vanilla bean. Rich creamy feel, a hint of warm booze that lingers on the finish. Low carb. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is high quality vanilla extract and coffee with some dark chocolate. Outstanding appearance - flat black with a mocha colored head. Taste is bitter dark chocolate with heavy coffee and vanilla undertones. Palate was a little watery; really the only unimpressive aspect of this beer. Very well done.

Bottle. It pours very dark brown with a bubbly beige head. The aroma is coffee and vanilla with sweet roasted notes. Some nuts. The flavor is sweet and roasted with coffee and bitter malty. Quite strong vanilla notes.
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2015 Black. Ruby highlights. Head a bit thin but holds a fine lace. Strong coffee nose vanilla a bit muted. Coffee dominates a bit much for mine overwhelming the base beer a bit

Black body, small light brown head. Aroma has huge paprika at first but then mellows to some nutty roasted coffee. Acidic and coaly flavour, some strange bit papery sweetness. Perhaps thats the vainilla.
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Black with tan head. Aromas of coffee, vanilla, milk chocolate. Tastes of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roast. Full body with a dry finish. Very tasty.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with a thick dark brown head. Aroma is strong coffee notes with subtle vanilla and a little pepper. Medium to full bodied with a dry bitter finish. Flavor is huge coffee. Also flavors of vanilla, chocolate, caramel, toffee, and pepper. Excellent Porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with a diminishing tan head and heavy lace. Big aromas of coffee and dark roasted malt. Light sweet start leading to coffee/espresso. Mild vanilla and hint of oak. Light lactose in the finish. Linger is fairly dry with a hint of bitterness. If you like strong coffee, you should really like this one. Fairly smooth and a bit sticky at times. 1/15

Dark brown with tan head. Aroma: coffee, hazel nuts, almonds, butterscotch. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, coffee, hazel nuts, vanilla. full body, sticky feel, average carbonation, long vanilla finish,

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 Bottle. Pours dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is lot of fresh coffe and vanilla, hazelnuts, almonds, toffee, butterscotsch, Taste is medium bitter, coffee bitterness, hazelnuts, vanilla toffee, butterscotsch, nice roast. Full body. Good beer- I want to have babys with this beer.

Very dark, almost black coloured beer with an off-white head. The aroma is mod. intensive with notes of espresso, vanilla, smoke and dark chocolate. The taste is very bitter, notes of dark chocolate and coffee. But the malty sweetness is also there. Very good, oily texture and full body. with a nice carbonation. Respect!

Bottle. Pours black with small light brown head. Aroma roasty coffee, cocoa powder, vanilla, dry, malts, fudge. Taste is similar. Tons of coffee and vanilla. Dry cocoa powder, chocolate. Soft oat. Light and smooth for ABV. Dry roasty coffee finish.Really balanced.

Chocolate vanilla with a hint of coffee come from this brown brew. Heavy chocolate taste with vanilla and the coffee comes through on the back of the tongue. It's full body and carb remind me more of a stout rather than a porter. Not a bad brew.

Taster at the brewery. Black color with nice beige head. Coffee chocolate aroma, like I love it. More coffee chocolate in the taste, roasted malts, full taste but stays dry, bitter chocolate/espresso finish. Huge drinkability for this ABV. Just feels a bit too fresh, could be more capturing. With a bit more thickness this would be absolutely over the top. But like this it is already extremely good.
Bottle. Heavy notes of roasted malts, old hops and coffee. A bit too heavy for my liking. Nice thick an smooth texture.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Near black with a beige head. Roast coffee with dark berries and vanilla. Marzipan alcohol with light funk. Creamy oak barrel with oatmeal and blackberries. Leather and white board marker pen with gritty dark chocolate. Boozy, warming finish. Brilliant.

Bottle. 
Quite sweet aroma. 
Heavy taste of coffee, rosted malts, chocolate and candy sugar.

Bottle.
Brown, black. Brown thick head.
Aroma of coffe, salty caramel
Coffee bitterness, some aluminum taste.
Fizzy. Dark

Bottle from Elmanana. Many thanks! Dark brown with brown head. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of cocoa, vanilla, roasted malts and coffee. Sweet with bitter finish. Caramel and vanilla. Not bad but not my favorite.

Keg at Brewdog Bristol. A deep brown colour with a thick mocha head. Aroma of fresh coffee beans, some roasted malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, liquorice and subtle tobacco. Taste of espresso, dark chocolate, some vanilla, slight alcohol, liquorice, nuts and a little pepper. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A warming, roasted, peppery hop bitterness in the finish. A nice imperial porter, Its lighter on the tongue than a stout but just has flavourful, great combination of coffee and vanilla.
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Huge spicy pepper coffee aroma. Vanilla dominates the flavor, coffee, delight ashy, astringent. No balance, little beer character.
Bottle my parents brought back from CA. Poured black with thick tan head. Aroma roasty sweet vanilla. Light carb med bod. Tastes light bitter resin hop choc.

a porter brewed with coffee and vanilla; deep dark brown to black with a thick tan head; coffee aroma with chocolate and vanilla notes; a creamy, chocolaty porter with slightly sweet roasted malt and lots of coffee notes and hints of vanilla; well balanced and very tasty

Mmmm, coffee! Pours nearly black w/ a retaining mocha head that leaves a lot of lacing. The aroma is an exquisite blend of coffee & vanilla. The taste is primarily coffee w/ a hint of vanilla in the middle & finally finishes bitter in true porter style. Its incredibly light on the palate for the complexity & 10% abv. Its bold, in your face deliciousness!
Bottle at The Bishops Arms, Vasagatan. Black with light brown head. Acidic coffee, rum and vanilla. Alcohol nose. Semi-dry, well-balanced in all directions. Great coffee flavours. A great beer.

Poured from the bottle of a six pack, jet black with an almost purple collar. This is a beer I had to have a few of to appreciate. At first I was only picking out what I dont like about porters, but by the second I was noticing positive characteristics like more of the vanilla, and definitely the strength. This is why I dont do beer tastings, because I feel I get robbed of the experience. Overall a good solid strong beer, even though not the style I prefer. The 10% is what made me pick it up cuz I have a hard time walking by the strong stuff.

Tap at Happy Gnome. Black with a medium sized light brown head. Strong coffee and vanilla aroma, a little oaky, dried leaves and chocolate malt balls. Taste is mostly sweet with a light coffee bitter finish. Body is heavier with a sticky feel.

22 oz. bottle. Pours pitch black, with a big, brown, bubbly head and lots of lacing. The aroma is bitter coffee, a touch of vanilla, a little syrup, and some harsh rye. Sweet flavor, with significant, roasty, unpleasant bitterness. Heavy body, silky, and thick. This is a reasonably tasty porter, but the excessive roast flavors arent my thing.

Draught @ Ginger Man. Inky dark brown with small spongy tan head, coffee beans aroma with a hint of vanilla, low carbonation, complex taste starting vanilla sweet and ending coffee bitter, full body, long bitter finish. Tastes more like a stout.

650ml bottle from trade with RobertDale. Thank you Bob! Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, lot of coffee, some cocoa and chocolate, light fruits. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma, espresso coffee and cocoa. Almost full oily to creamy body with soft carbonation.

Black with a thick tan head, and lots of lovely lace. Aroma is rather abrasive at first, but mellows as the beer warms. Lots of coffee, roasted malts, a bit of toffee, and the barest hint of chocolate. Flavor is incredibly robust and bitter. The mouthfeel is abrasive at first, but again, it mellows as the beer warms. A very good ale all around.

Bottle, by way of trade with Saeglopur. Clear, very dark, chestnut brown. Thin, lasting, tan head. Rich, fruity chocolate. Nuts, and vanilla. This is basically a liquified, boozed up bar of Cadburys Fruit and Nut. Which is a very good thing. Taste is musvoado sugar sweet. Some vine fruit, woody, dryness. Hint of coffee bean bitter. Smooth, rich, way under the ABV palate. Finishes long, fruity, chocolatey bitter. Fantastic beer. Silly easy drinking. Cheers Thomas!

Two of the worlds oldest beverages join forces to conquer your palate. Victory at Sea embodies the art of masterful brewing by infusing a velvety Imperial Porter with pure vanilla flavor and specially-selected, hand roasted coffee. The addition of cold brewed coffee to the beer lends a subtle roasted flavor to this robust imperial porter, blending perfectly with rich vanilla and caramel undertones. By uniting two San Diego brewing traditions, Caffe Calabria freshly brewed coffee and Ballast Point beer, we have successfully created an artisanal masterpiece.
Pours a nice dark brown, with a tan head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, and malts. Taste is rich and complex, with lots of wood, vanilla, and just enough coffee. This a delicious porter, thumbs way up!

Outstanding beer. Paired with ice cream. Making this a porter instead of a stout was a great idea. It was a bit thick for a porter, but just right in effect. Tasted of roasted malt, coffee and vanilla. Balance was perfect. Pairing with plain vanilla ice cream was also perfect as the creaminess of the ice cream went well with the mouthfeel and flavor of the beer.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours very dark brown, no head. Nose is strong cold coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste is coffee beans, cold coffee, light vanilla, some sweetness.
Draft at NHC. Nose is coffee. Taste is huge roast and coffee. You can taste the alcohol. Big beer.
A delicious porter, with great coffee and chocolate notes, the high abv gives a luxurious mouthfeel , but this remains very drinkable .

12oz bottle. Pours dark with a tan head. Delicious porter with a nice combination of vanilla and coffee notes. Both the vanilla and coffee flavors are clearly derived from high quality ingredients and play a central role in this one. The high alcohol does not come through in flavor or burn but I definitely felt it after taking my last sip.
Bottle from Mother Kellys. Great impy porter here - vanilla and coffee well integrated. Super smooth too. Roasty bitterness on the end. Alcohol? What alcohol?
Keg at Brewdog AGM. Pours black, nose is huge coffee, roasted, chocolate, taste is bitter, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, roasted.

Keg at Brewdog AGM 2015. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head. Aromas of green coffee beans, dark toffee, liquorice. Taste is more coffee and toffee. Rich, oily texture. Roasted bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle: deep brown, thick chocolate head and great lace. Very lifted intense roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla and coffee. Great complexity, depth and freshness. Creamy. Dry, not sour and moderately bitter. Great depth and concentration of flavor. 
At 10% this is amazingly fresh and balanced. Love this beer.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham; opaque black pour with a thin tan head, deep roast coffee, treacle and chocolate aroma, rich coffee, dark chocolate, some molasses, a hint of vanilla, pleasant viscous mouthfeel, delightful.

L:
-pours a dark brown with reaaaaaaaaaaaaaaallllllly faint ruby tinges with a medium,creamy,khaki head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
coffee,mocha,cappucino,vanilla,chocol body,medium carbonation
-alcohol scary well hidden
O:
-Absolute Beast of a Beer
The coffee scents are very prominent, the color is thick and dark. After drinking a 3 year aged Dogfish this is a little harsh, but it's definitely not a harsh beer
Pffeiffentaback, Vanille, Espresso, Weltklasse Porter vom Feinsten -------- via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, London. A very dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium dense beige head on top. Roasty, malty, coffee, vanilla aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, coffee, vanilla, some chocolate too. Rich with a slight sweetness. Gorgeous Imperial Stout from Ballast Point.
Bottle from Cornelis Pub. Big.creamy Beige head. Smells of coffee, almond, vanilla, hazelnut, chocolate. Tastes chocolate, almond, coffee. Sweet and bitter. Amazing.

Lately, Ive sounded like a broken record when it comes to dark beer. Beers brewed with coffee have left me wanting more coffee. Apparently, Victory at Sea heard my pleas. Using the cold brewed technique (Im becoming a bigger fan all the time) of coffee infusion, Victory at Sea has a big roasted smell and taste. Whats impressive is that the vanilla finds its way into the nose and palate, too, adding sweet and spicy notes. At times, the vanilla pairs with the coffee to create a flavor like mocha. At others, the coffee hits first and finishes with sweet vanilla. Either way, the flavors are incredible. This Imperial Porter is smooth yet strong. Its damn near perfect.
Vanilla, roast coffee, and alcohol in the aroma. Great bittersweet flavor with coffee, caramel, chocolate, and vanilla. Surprisingly sweet finish with some roast coffee bitterness. Fantastic.

Bottle: YUMMY! Full bodied porter with amazing balance in the sweetness of the vanilla and coffee. Not too sweet like Breckenridge, and not too much coffee. Just right. Enjoyable around the firepit on a late Spring night.

Bottle.

A- Coffee, mocha, chocolate, vanilla, subtle caramel, roasty, Starbucks frappuccino.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Coffee, slightly bitter, roasty, vanilla, mocha.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty bitter finish.

O- WOW. This may be the best damn smelling beer ever. So aromatic. It smells like a vanilla Starbucks frappuccino. So much coffee, vanilla, and goodness. The taste is about the same. The coffee and vanilla notes are played out exceptionally. A little bitter as it warms on the palate but still great. Not much Id do to change this one. I want another.

Black in color with a think, frothy, tan head with great lacing. Strong coffee aroma with chocolate and vanilla notes. Has a light sweetness with a slight bitterness. Leaves a sticky feeling in my mouth. Leaves a long drawn out finish. Coffee and chocolate taste. Very good beer that is definetly worth buying again.

Tap at the brewery with commonshawn, rosskyle, and wildcard. Large tulip glass. Deep plum color pushing black. Aroma is sweet molasses and roasted malt. Taste starts out sweet almost like a syrupy sweet stout. It moves towards the bitter, porter roasted malt notes stopping in the middle to bring on an alcohol hit. Caramel is present with some chocolate notes. Very good beer...best of the Ballast Point stable.

Tap at brewery. Black with small white tan head. Smells amazing. Strong vanilla and chocolate. Some syrupy chocolate sugar. Very smooth. Only slightly sweet, good malt and late bitterness . Finish is good but flavor doesn?t last so much at the end. Really good.

Served on tap at ballast point. Dark black color with medium brown head. Coffee chocolate aroma. Medium heavy body. Smooth texture. Sweet chocolate coffee with a little bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with tan head. Nose is heavy coffee and chocolate - no vanilla. But the taste is a vanilla bomb with some coffee notes. Incredibly smooth. Excellent porter - if anything, maybe a drop heavy on the vanilla.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska. Finfin doft! Här finns havdoft o kaffe o vanilj. Smaken är riktigt trevlig o balanserad. Kaffe med vanilj i lagom doser. En riktigt god stout!!

Underbar doft av kaffe, vanilj. Smakar tydligt kaffe, choklad å sen rejält med vanilj. Jävligt fyllig Porter. Inte ett uns av alkohol slår igenom 10%. Fin som faan. En rik Porter i fin amerikansk stil.

Smooth with coffee and caramel. Great tasting beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pretty nice looking beer. Dark chocolate brown, black basically, dark tan head.

As advertised, aroma is heavy on vanilla and coffee. Roasted barley is heavy. There are some fairly strong fruit notes in the back, which are a little outputting for me. 

Taste is pretty strong, especially for a porter. Sweetness dominates. 

Body is medium-strong. Soft carbonation. Very long finish. 

Overall, this is a well made beer, but wouldnt buy again. The aroma is really nice, but the fruit notes are just too strong. It would be so nice without them. The coffee and vanilla are strong (and great).

Pours dark black with white head. Aroma and taste of coffee and vanilla. Strong and rather bitter. Pretty high and strong kick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bottle. Appearance is dark black with creamy head. Aroma is vanilla, marshmellows, coffee, and roasted malts. Taste is coffee, vanilla, and chocolate, with a bitter sweet coffe finish. This is really good, nice amount of coffee and vanilla, reminds me a little bit of a Vietnamese coffee.

Pours pitch black with nice head. Aroma: fresh brewed sweet coffee and vanilla. Taste: very well balanced coffee and vanilla, dark roasted malt and nice hoppy palate and a touch of coffee sourness. ABV incredibly well hidden.This beer is very drinkable, which at the same time makes it dangerous. Fantastic stuff.
Strong roasty aromas, coffee, dark chocolate, cherry. Black with a somewhat lasting tan head. Dry, roasty flavors. Full bodied.

on tap @ Vino Belissimo / Lima OH --- Clear dark brown color, brown head, curtain of lace. Taste is roasted malt that adds semi-sweet toffee on the swallow, retaining a somewhat bitter attitude through an extended finish. A really solid "hair on your chest" brisk brew. Assertive and complex. Recommended.

Black colour, brown head, aroma of vanilla, coffee, bitter chocolate, cocoa, nougat, and hazelnuts. Taste is medium sweet medium bitter, vanilla and coffee flavour, medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very good for the vanilla lovers.

Excellent beer with hint of coffee and chocolate nibs. Smooth and easy. Better warmer than cold. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark pour with an average sized khaki head. Upon lifting this to my nose, the first scent I get is coffee with undertones of caramel, smoke, oak, and vanilla. Ballast Point has churned out another good beer. This works pretty well. Only complaint is the palate could be a bit smoother for my liking.
Bottle fromMarco. Jet black with a tan head. Aroma is deep coffee. Flavour is intense roast, everything, malt, coffee, chocolate, creamy, toasty, delicious.

From 22oz bottle to shaker. Pour is about black with a thick tan head. Nose is huge roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, molasses. Taste is sour and sweet with a heavy body. Finishes sharp and dry. Huge beer
Pours black with a minimal tan head. Aroma and tastes of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and booze as it warms. Full bodied silky mouth feel. Reminds me Brooklyn chocolate stout.
Pours black. Aroma is of coffee, malts and roasty toastiness. Full bodied. Flavor is the same. Great stuff.

Cervesa amb un fort aroma a cafè, en boca segueix aquest aroma però també amb un toc a vainilla.
Cerveza con un fuerte aroma a café, en boca sigue este mismo aroma pero también con un toque a vainilla.

Backlog, bottle. Dark brown/black, two finger beige head, dissipates quick leaving some lacings. Aroma is coffe, chocolate, swedish julmust, malt, slight alcohol. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, minor bitter hoppiness in the finish. Full body, medium carbo, oily texture. Good and well balanced.

Pours jet black. Aroma is intense vanilla and coffee right of the bat, some dark roasted malt tones in the background as well, one of the best smelling beers i ever had!

Taste is actually a bit overbearing on the vanilla, would have preferred more coffee and roasted malts, this was a very fresh bottle and vanilla tends to fade so this is one for the cellar indeed!
Still top notch imperial porter/stout!

Bottle from SB.

Black, mostly dark brown, porter that has a small tan head and not much lacing. Smells of coffee and vanilla dominate the aroma. Taste follows suit with the coffee coming in strong to start with the vanilla and a sweetness to end. Nice bodied brew with a somewhat thicker feel than other porters and quite drinkable for being 10% abv. Overall, an awesome imperial porter that wont disappoint!

Sharing bottle. Dark, dark amber, almost black body with a medium sized dense beige head. Strong aroma of dark, smooth roasted malt, dark chocolate and some warming alcohol. Flavor is strong, but very smooth and balanced, dark, roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, coffee and pleasant bitterness. Fine, strong and balanced body with a long lasting aftertaste of dark malt and warming alcohol. Great beer all the way.
Coffee, vanilla, chocolate, these are a few of my favorite things. Throw them into a fantastic porter and I'll give it 4.2 stars. Drink up, victory is yours.

Tar black with a small tight beige head. Strong aroma of coffee beans, some vanilla, dark chocolate and a hint of tobacco. Taste - wow! Super smooth - espresso coffee, molasses, vanilla, a little chocolate, sherry and caramel. Velvet smooth with just a little prickle on the tongue. Medium bodied, well disguised booze. Superb.

Could this be the best Imperial Porter out there? All signs point towards yes. The label design is beautiful. The beer is wonderfully aromatic, tastes like a coffee shop fantasy, and has 10% alcohol.

*After having a taste, I added it to my iced mocha coffee. Tastes just as good with the chocolate as well.

So much coffee. So delicious. This magnificent brew is probably my favorite imperial porter. Roasty, chocolatey, dark currant, and espresso dominate the flavor profile. Only a hint of alcohol present in the finish and very drinkable. Definitely a fan.

Bottle, $3.20 Wine Warehouse, CHO.

Pours black and thick. Looks wonderful. Small brown head.

Yummy chocolate, coffee, green peppers, dust, and vanilla in the nose.

Heavy cold coffee, dark chocolate, and vanilla. Yum.

Black and very little head at all, fine for a porter. Aroma of coffee is stronger than the vanilla. But both are there. Strong roasted malt character. Increased in promonence by the coffee flavor, bit it holds back from tasting like it was burnt. Vanilla in the flavor also. Thick, heavy, and very smooth palate.

(350ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, April 21 2015) Pours black with a medium brown head and some lace. Aroma powerfully espresso driven with lots of vanilla as well, a bit of chocolate for support, roasty and not very sweet. Taste echoes the palate, rich coffee and vanilla with a bit of chocolate in support, fairly heavily roasted, slightly sweet dark malt. Dries out pretty quickly, roasty coffee, a bit of cacao, earthy, a bit of hop bitterness. Finish is very dry, lean and roasty with some coffee and vanilla lingering on, almost a peppery quality to the bitterness. Medium bodied, not too thick with average carbonation. Compared to a rich stout this is quite dry and has that lean roasty finish so the aftertaste isnt as intense. A really nice porter though, the flavour additions come through well.

Bottle bought at Beverage World. Pours a deep brown/black split, and the aroma is immediate: chocolate, coffee, espresso, vanilla, wow! Flavor also has a coffee profile...I really think the cold brew made a difference in the taste. Full body but smooth. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Aroma of cold pressed coffee, sweet cream, and Vanilla. Appearance is pitch black body with a dark brown head. Lacing is noticed on the glass while drinking. Taste is of cold pressed black coffee, vanilla bean, sweet cream, and slight black licorice flavor. A slight bitter after taste in the back of the tongue follows when swallowing.

It was OK but, strange to say this, seemed to have too much flavor. You can taste the coffee, the vanilla, maybe that was part of the licorice taste too. Very dark with a coffee smell, a bit heavy, it was "Ok"

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Big think used motor oil body. Tons of burnt coffee beans, mild vanilla bean. Heavily roasted malt, earthy balanced hops. Long burnt coffee finish. Alcohol well hidden. Very nice !

From notes on 3/28/15

Lots of coffee aroma. Smooth and tasty. Dark think body. Tons of coffee flavor with undertones of vanilla. Victory!

The pour is black with a small brown head on top. Aromas are coffee and a little bit of alcohol and chocolate. The flavor reminds me of cappuccino with a vanilla flavor shot added to it, or maybe coffee ice cream. Thick and chewy and slightly carbonated mouthfeel with lingering coffee. Great imperial porter, and nice to see something so good widely distributed and easy to buy.

Draft. Dark chocolate brown/black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma is full of delicious coffee, espresso, Along with chocolate. Flavor also features delicious coffee, espresso. Full body. smooth. Mild to moderate roast and bitterness. Intense but smooth.

E di colore nero impenetrabile; bella la schiuma, cremosa, color kaki, persistente, piuttosto buona lallacciatura. Al naso è subito dominio di malto tostato e caffè macinato, cioccolato nero e lievi note di vaniglia. Al palato viene confermato quanto percepito al naso, possente il gusto di caffè, di orzo torrefatto e di cioccolato extra fondente, seguiti ancora da lievi sapori di vaniglia; il retrogusto è felicemente amaro/caffeoso. :-D

Tastes the way it tells us in the label, vanilla and coffee. The beer is very good, very sweet. This is one of the best porters out there imo. Has a similar taste to a stout, but less heavy. A very drinkable beer.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2015 On Tap @Kips, Pint pour is dark brown. Nice Mocha head which dissipates quickly with sparse lacing. The aroma is coffee up front, with chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts. Taste is sweet vanilla, coffee, chocolate, the alcohol is well hidden. Would recommend this highly to all my friends!

Aroma: coffee, vanilla, roasty, 
Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, 
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, coffee, vanilla
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Dark brown to black color, darker tan head. Aroma is sweet malt, vanilla and coffee candy. Taste is quite sweet caramel, milk chocolate, some vanilla, roasted coffee beans and vanilla flavored coffee. Full bodied, very well hidden but still noticeable alcohol heat. Very nice.
3/29/2015. From bottle. Black with a thick, creamy tan head. Vanilla aromas with chocolate and roasted malt. Flavors are bitter up front, then lots of coffee, chocolate. Long bitter finish.

Appearance: Black bodied beer with a creamy dark tan head. The head fades shortly and leaves some spots of lacing on the glass.

Aroma: There is a very strong coffee-shop aroma to the beer accompanied by a woody oak-like aroma. I dont pick up any vanilla aroma.

Taste: It has a very nice dark chocolate flavor with some bitter roasted presence and a strong dark coffee flavor. I dont pick up any vanilla flavor. There is a notable lack of alcohol flavor which is nice.

Mouthfeel: It is extremely smooth and thick and velvety. The aftertaste gives a good bite of bitterness.

Overall: Its an excellent porter. I didnt get any vanilla presence in this beer at all which was disappointing, but ignoring the lack of vanilla still makes it a great coffee porter. I would recommend it and I would pick it up again.

330 bottle from Bierdeluxe.de, Germany. Black color with a thin brown head. Aroma is coffee, some dark chocolate and some raisins. Taste is bitter and phenomenal, especially at warmer temperatures. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted notes, plums, raisins. Perfect. Aftertaste is mildly bitter and long. Medium to full body with low carbonation.

Pours dark and black but not thick with a 1/2 inch brown and tan head. Aroma is of coffee and cherries. Flavor is dry and crisp dark coffee. Light vanilla and roasty malt. Alcohol is hidden and more crisp and dry than an imp stout. Really tasty and a must try.
Bottle BBE 12/10/13. Pours brownish black with small brown head. Coffee amd vanilla ice cream. Burnt malt and coffee with hints of chili. A very nice imperial porter.

Really nice imperial porter. Dark chocolate, amounts of vanilla and dark chocolate. Really tasty. Only bad thing is that its get a little bit to much in the long run. Would love to try the Bourbon aged version.

12 oz bottle: Now available in 6 packs! :)
Great looking, with a frothy tan head that leaves lovely lacing and has great retention. 
Aroma: coffee, dark roasted grains, vanilla and alcohol, in that order. 
Flavor: initially more subdued coffee allowing a nicely balanced mix, but the coffee does build at the end and build with repeated sipping. Vanilla is subtle.

Poured from bottle at 54F. Pours a dark brown with a 1 finger tan head. Head leaves lots of lacing. Aroma - cocoa nibs, coffee, smoked green chile. Taste - holy cow big; dark chocolate, dark coffee, alcohol and a touch of vanilla. Mouthfeel is rich and a touch oily. It is a bit too big and coffee-centered for me.

Lovely monster. Appearance is a large tan, slow to settle, thick head with lots of lace and and opaque black brown color. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, roast malt, leather, black earth, dank forest, cement. Flavors similar to nose, fairly dry, just enough tang and bitter to balance and then a hint of sweet in the finish. Body is just right. Long finish. Nary a hint of strength.
Holy gadzooks batman, this stuff rocks. I feel an urge to watch old WW2 movies about victory at Coral Sea and Midway. Lots of bitter coffee, mocha, black walnuts and buncha other stuff. Loved it.

Pours black with a large tan head.
Aroma of vanilla, roasted malt and very soft coffee.
Flavours include more vanilla and a fair bit of sweet malt. A fair whack of coffee too.

12oz Pours an impenetrable black with a small tan head. Smell of coffee beans and vanilla, with some other complexities. Is thick bodied and relatively well carbonated. Dark coffee flavors dominate and make for a bitter, dry beer. Alcohol is well hidden by bitterness, not much vanilla when tasting just bitter coffee. Very solid and impressive for 10%.
Deep brown pour. Smoky coffee aromas with some background bitterness. Sweet on sipping. Chewy palate. Dry finish. Coffee and vanilla syrup. Slightly medicinal finish.

Bomber. Pours a virtually opaque brownish-black, frothy espresso colored head with excellent retention and lacing. Nose is a massive wallop of coffee beans, leather, wood, roasted barley, hint of vanilla. Mouth is oily and coffee forward, bittersweet, vanilla, brown sugar, undertones of dried fruit, earthiness, leather. Finishes a touch hot (ABV on this one is prominent... might grab another bottle to cellar -- which at $7.99 is a no-brainer!).

Pours a completely opaque black with a nice, big and lasting creamy beige head. Aroma is coffe and vanilla with some liquorice. Flavor is boozy coffee with a rich vanilla sweetness, but never overwhelming or burning, kind of drinkable for its weight. Medium to heavy palate, complex layered, great sipping imperial porter.

From a bottle into a snifter. Huge hit of coffee and vanilla, some chocolate. Medium body, slightly oily, medium carbonation, medium sweetness. Long finish with tons of vanilla. Pretty easy to drink, very enjoyable.

Bottle. Near black in colour with moderate carbonation. Big hit of coffee and roasted malt on the nose, along with some dark chocolate notes. Vanilla starts to show in the mouth, along with some espresso grinds, mild caramel, and a bit of chalk. Medium bodied. Quite drinkable considering its weight, but the finish is a bit on the chalky/over-roasted/astringent side.
Schwarz. In der Nase brutale Kaffeenoten, Espresso, Röstmalz, röstiger Kaffee, leichte Vanille. Heftig. Am Gaumen Röstmalz, Kaffee, leichte süße, Vanille, dunkle Früchte, schöne Balance. Cremig. TOP!

Dark roasty nose, coffee and dark chocolate. Very dark brown color, dark tan head. Big roast initial, slightly oversteeped coffee, light chocolate notes, and some very nice dark fruit hiding amidst it all. Medium-heavy body, very smooth on the tongue. Great stuff.

This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a pure black color with a slim concave off white slightly foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. Slim stringy lacing roams around the glass.
The smell starts off with a rich roasty coffee and vanilla blend. A light cocoa enters in ever so slightly as it warms.
The taste was roasty sweet cocoa and balances a slight bitterness from the coffee. A super smooth vanilla roastiness rolls over the aftertaste and finish.
On the palate, this one sat oh so smooth and roasty coffee and vanilla. Its a nice balancing act of flavors relinquishing delicacy of harshness but nothing overbearing.
Overall, imperial porter - check. Awesomeness - check! As a night cap - priceless!

Opaque, clear. 
Sweet nose. 
Full body, intense flavor, high alcohol heat, lingering palate. 
Bitter but well balanced by sweetness. 
Strong roast flavors, coffee, vanilla, alcoholic, liquorice, a touch medicinal. 
Did not disappoint. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Dark brown pour, thin tan head, no lace. Big coffee aroma, a little smoke, light vanilla. Flavor is mostly dark roast coffee, some roasted malt, vanilla on the finish. Not very complex, but still tasty.

Draught (!) pour, bier-deluxe import BKL 15 - FR. Lesson learned here: If you are going to chuck loads of vanilla beans and artisan coffee, your beer is going to taste of vanilla and coffee. Among 500+ brews at the fesival, this wins the Starbucks Flavoured Frappucino Award for infantilising grown mens palates by attacking them with upfront and over-obvious vanilla and coffee infusions so dank that the probably fine base ImpStout beneath cowers into invisibility/inpalpability. Even as a big coffee and moderate vanilla lover, I do not need my beer to taste of Mr Brown cold iced espresso with vanilla. Some roast and caramels survive the onslaught, while the mouthfeel is oily and slick. Remains drinkable as a freak dessert. One cannot help but wonder whether the pubescent palates voting this skyhigh into the RB Olymp alongside artisanal, slow-brewed masterpieces (on both sides of the pond) had this alongside with a cheeseburger, a Butterfinger and some Oreos.

Just absolutely delicious. This beer pours dark brown, the head fades to a thin lace. The aroma is coffee, rich roasted malt, and sweet/spicy notes like apple butter. The flavor is wonderful. Very warm vanilla is laced throughout the taste, with more of that rich, sweet malt and a strong coffee finish knocking this thing out of the park.

Draught at Braukunst Live München 2015.
Black body, with a big, creamy, dark beige to brown head.
Aroma of dry coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa powder.
Taste follows this, with some more hazelnut, subtle dark fruits.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a good carbonation.
Finishes roasty, dry, with chococolate, coffee, cocoa.

Wow! Perfect balance, with an amazing roasty-dry, yet smooth profile. Alcohol is also greatly hidden. Easily the best Imperial Porter Ive had so far!

On tap in tulip glass, showing pitch black with half a finger of dark coffee foam. Foam lasts quite a while. 

Strong grassy notes with only subtle hints of unroasted coffee bean on the nose. 

The palate shows a lot of strong milk chocolate on the attack and warms up into a little more coffee flavors. Full bodied, elegant carbonation, dry but the vanilla balances out coffee flavors to almost a very light latte bitterness. Drinks like a stout with the body of a lighter porter.

Dark brown, ruby glint and ringed sandy wet head. Bright roast and Slint ofnv8nailla.neat tangy roast. Mouthfeel is soft and gloopy, gl8nt of bitterness. Carv8natuon is chewy and vanilla. Marshmallow. Finishs lean bitter roast and crystal caramel seep

Black pour with a single finger, slightly off white head. Aroma of coffee and vanilla. Really smells like a vanilla coffee. Medium mouth. Taste is like drinking a vanilla coffee. Big time roast is washed away by the sweet vanilla. A really nice beer.

on tap at Braukunst Live, Munich. black color, coffee colored head, strong & very nice smell of coffee, roasty aroma, light milk, chocolate, cacao. full body, very chocolaty taste, coffee, toffee, medium bubbly, some licorice, nice oily texture. nice chocolate / light coffee finish. wow, great beer.

(draught) black colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of heavy espresso, some dark chocolate and rum, with a hint of sugar icing, vanilla and some toasted malts. flavour is mostly vanilla and heavy dark chocolate, with some light ash, a touch of sugar icing and a heavy-bitter herbal-hoppy finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.
Pours very dark brown with a lasting head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee and malt. Delicious taste with a very nice palate too

Bottle. Pours black with an off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, some alcohol and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some roasted notes, grains and roasted notes. Medium to full body, average carbonation.
Lovely subtle vanilla and even coffee aroma. Sweet when chilled, not as much so as it warms. The coffee never punches you in the mouth, it?s just a willing partner.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 This beer pours a dark brown almost black with a medium khaki head that left some good lacing around the glass. The aroma is strong! I pick up coffee, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, and some oak. This aroma is so sweet and inviting. The taste is overwhelming dark roasted bitter coffee with some hints of vanilla, burnt caramel, some oakiness, and chocolate. It is a great mixture of bitterness up front and sweetness on the backside. For being 10% abv it is hidden quite well and the drinkability is quite high. The mouthfeel is on the medium to heavy side. Some beers dont live up to their hype, however, this beer exceeds its hype. This is a world class beer and a must try!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Bottle - dark brownish/black pour with creamy beige head. Aroma - vanilla, coffee, musty wood and some booze. Taste is pretty damn nice. Each sip is different. First you taste the vanilla and then this smooth coffee flavor with hint dark chocolate! I swirled it in my snifter and the vanilla and coffee just popped! Palate - mouthfeel is somewhat oily and aftertaste is almost nonexistent. Overall an enjoyable beer. Tastes more like 6% abv and goes down smooth! Probably a touch too much vanilla but otherwise perfect.

Pours dark brown with a small brown head. Aroma is super fresh coffee. Flavor is nice coffee, slight vanilla and roasted porter, too sweet to really love it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

/too dark to see through, & a rockier head than ive seen in a long time, like a natural sponge. you cant sescape the chocolate, in aroma or flavor. taste-wise theres dark coffee, walnut & toffee. aroma has lumber & caramel. ligt and smooth on the pallet. a little on the sweet side but rich tasting.

Magnificient beer from such a magnifiscient brewery! Aromas are litterally on the vanilla side. Burnt sugar on the nose, warm smells of caramel and crème brûlée, this nose is smooth and complex. The head is very tiny, quite inexistant Id rather say. Taste is half and half coffee/vanilla. This beer stands for his strong dynamics balanced with this beer-you-could-drink-all-day kind of lightness. Big WOW for me!!!

[Bottle] Pours dark brown with a small brown head. Aroma is big on coffee, caramel, and vanilla. Some vegetal notes come and go. Taste is also a blast of coffee, fairly hot, lots of vanilla, and cherry undertones. Smooth, decent mouthfeel, with a long finish that is fairly dry. Overall, a nice beer, although the caramel and vanilla are too strong, and the off-notes in the aroma drag it down.

Pours a medium thick black with a tan/chocolaty brown thin head. Smells of coffee, but has stronger vanilla and chocolate notes. Taste is heavily bitter coffee with an after taste fading into a sweeter vanilla blend. Im not a huge coffee fan, so this one is gets knocked down just a peg on the taste, but overall its quite good.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Very enjoyable imperial porter.While I did feel it was a tad thinner than I wanted, it is a porter and not a stout after all and was smooth and creamy. A bitter iced coffee flavor dominates the taste with subtle hints of vanilla and maybe some earthy spice in the finish? The bitter coffee flavor lingers and continues to please my taste buds well beyond finishing the beer. Glad I picked this up.

Appearance: Dark black color, tan head. 
Taste: heavy coffee. Toasted malt.
Aroma is coffee vanilla.
Good, but strong. Sipping beer.

Pours black with a tan head. Aromas of vanilla, chocolate syrup, creme brulee, coffee, and toffee. Taste of vanilla, intense bitter charred wood, molasses, coffee, chocolate syrup, and caramel. Strongly bitter, med-full body. Carbonation a bit prickly. Finishes dry with a lingering burnt marshmallow taste. This is a great imperial porter. Sort of a kick in the face but in a good way.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Poured from 12oz into tulip. Strong notes of vanilla and coffee, although the coffee is nowhere near as much roast character as other coffee porters.

Blackish brown. Nose of fresh, cold-steeped coffee and cream with light roast. Flavor is mildly acidic fresh coffee with roast malt, bitter chocolate and faint vanilla/cream. Lingering bitter roast and lightly acidic coffee. Thinner.

Pours semi-opaque amber-brown with two fingers of loose tan head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, heavy lacing. (4/5) Nose is strong milky coffee, vanilla, mild cocoa. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (9/10) Full creamy body, moderate carbonation, slightly sticky astringent coffee finish. (4/5)

Very nicely balanced sweet strong milky coffee with mild vanilla. Were it not for the carbonation, you might be able to convince somebody in a blind taste test they were drinking iced café au lait. Yes, it really is dominated by the coffee to that extent - and thats not even close to being a criticism. The huge alcohol is nearly non-existent, except for a distinct tendency for the room to get a little wobbly towards the end of the bomber. (18/20)

Pours not so dark brown, I guess thats why they call it a porter. Aroma is strong, sweet vanilla and coffee, roastiness, chocolate cake, caramel. Mouthfeel is smooth, but not as thick as I was expecting. Flavors take you through all the different ways to taste coffee, from a sweet, coffee ice cream flavor that slowly evolves into black coffee with solid, perfect bitterness on the finish.
10abv comes off a little hot, palate is not velvety its slightly dry, coffee, vanilla, would not buy again. This is not a horrible beer but it does nothing well
Nice porter. Amazing dark brown colour. Nose and palate full of Coffee and chocolate, nice taste maybe a little too sweet for me.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2016 12oz bottle from Deguchiya. Poured into a stemmed tulip. Opaque iced coffee black color with a huge chocolate colored soapy head. Great lacing throughout. Huge bitter roasted coffee and vanilla aromas present. As it warms up a slight alcohol aroma is noticeable along with a bit of wood. Great vanilla and dark roasted coffee flavours on the palate with a bitter finish. Mouthfeel is like soda. The alcohol becomes more noticeable on the finish and hangs around on the tongue. Lowered my taste rating due to the bitterness and alcohol standing out a little more than I overzealously remembered.

Old rating from 2014: (10/4/10/4/19: 4.7) On tap at watering hole in Tokyo. Served in a snifter. Iced coffee back with a gorgeous toasted marshmallow colored head. Huge vanilla and iced coffee with milk aroma. Taste is pure bliss. Mouthfeel is perfect. Vanilla is a little strong, but tastes natural. Balances out really well with the coffee. Also nice chocolate undertones as well. Almost like a creamy cafe mocha. Alcohol is seemingly non-existent if going by drinkability. What an amazing beer.

2/12/15. Bomber from 2013. Pours dark mahogany with a deep mocha head. Strong vanilla nose. Great mouth with wonderful balance of coffee vanilla and alcohol. Aged nicely. Hops are far back but good malt backbone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Ballast Point Little Italy, San Diego - CA. Color: dark velvet black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, coffee and vanilla beans domination. Caramel and brown sugar notes. Very nice bouquet! Taste: good viscosity on mouth, vanilla and coffee domination. Roasted malt and caramel as well. Notes of brown sugar and licorice. Aftertaste: vanilla and alcohol finish.

Aroma of coffee, roasted malt and vanilla. Very robust aroma. Flavor is roasted malt and coffee with a vanilla finish. Very bitter, almost cocoa like bitterness. Strong flavors but doesn't taste strong alcohol. Nice, well made Porter, but a bit too bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sick growler from Bottles Packs and Growlers in Philly. Coffee and vanilla, as advertised, are the prevalent flavors here, goes down smooth as silk. Excellent.

Also, they get points for the name. I remember my grandfather showing me the Victory at Sea documentary when I was a kid. As an adult, I joined the Naval Service (United States Marine Corps), and continued the tradition of kicking ass and taking names. Semper Fi!

Beautiful aroma. All coffee. Like cold pressed coffee with a taste of vanilla. Beautiful pallate don't taste a hint of booze for such a big beer. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a very small tan head. Aroma is of vanilla, toasted malt, and coffee. Definitely smells inviting. Taste is of vanilla, chocolate, and toasted malt. There is also a slight note of coffee. Lingering taste of chocolate and vanilla. Almost has the taste of a Milky Way. Mouthfeel is creamy, without being too heavy. It actually goes down way too easy. The alcohol is well masked. As it warms, a bitter coffee. Flavor comes through. Just all around fantastic.

12oz into a sample glass, shared with dean. Pours a deep black midnight. Head is soft brown medium head, lacing is spotty and adequate. Aroma of vanilla, sweet chocolate, malts of glory, and coffee. Taste of immaculate malty goodness, vanilla, booze, chocolate, vanilla wafers, smoked malts, and toffee. Awesome.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 Had in bottle. First taste is very vanilla but towards the end the coffee comes out much more. Deep rich flavor. Dark coloring. (Just had on tap too. Less coffee bitters. More of the malts come through)

First it starts with the gorgeous roasted coffee aroma while being poored into my snifter like a starbucks is near. Very light head and dark bodied imperial porter which hits the mark as the creamy light vanilla frothiness followed by the French roast carbonation pound my tongue in sensation. Bottom line this one dope coffee porter and one to be reckoned with in its competition.

22oz bottle pours dark brown black with a finger of light tan foam. Nose has lots of earthy coffee, marshmallow and vanilla, and dusty milk chocolate. Taste has a nice creamy smooth mouthfeel, white chocolate vanilla with some hints of raisinet, coffee bean, and chocolate milk. Finishes semi sweet, chocolate shake, touch of roast balances the vanilla cream. Really nice.

Have had in the Bomber and 12oz bottle formats. Damn theres a lot of rating on this! Not much to be said beyond all a yall, but this shit is the tits! Beautiful blend of roast, coffee, and vanilla. Looking for the BA version now am I...

Pours black as coal with no head at all......aroma of wet coffee grounds, mustiness, flowery stuff in the background......taste is vanilla, coffee, sweet candy toffee, finishing with a bitter coffee finish. Tasted far better than the smell.

This is the kind of beer name I typically dont like (just call your vanilla porter a vanilla porter, for fucks sake!) but Victory at Sea sounds pretty cool to me so congrats to Ballast Point for coming up w/ a cutesy name that doesnt entirely suck badger tadger. This is a deep brown beer w/ a long-lasting foamy brown head. The vanilla is used really well in this beer. It is very apparent but not overwhelming and its presence serves to highlight a bunch of minor players typically present in roasty ales that are normally only supporting rolls. It brings out the chocolate from the coffee and roasted grains and also a nice cherry and cinnamon note presumably from the yeast or maybe hops--not that I have any way of knowing. This is a rich and creamy brew w/ a flavor profile which implies sweetness w/o the beer itself being all heavy and sticky. The coffee is really well done too w/ good, solid flavor but no harsh, ashy old day old coffee notes. Definitely, if you are one to like big stouts and porters w/ lots of coffee and vanilla in them, you are going to like this as much as you like anything.

12 oz. bottle poured into snifter. Oily black body with a one finger light brown head. Over the top aroma of coffee. With that came a hint of dark chocolate. Bitey and sharp acidity on the tongue, with the vanilla coming through to save you from puckering. Overall a nice beer, if you really enjoy coffee, but it might benefit from a more balanced finish.

12oz bottle from CBB. It pours into my snifter a viscous inky black with a dense tan head and a powerful nose of roasted coffee beans. Close your eyes and inhale that coffee roasters aroma. Medium bodied with a slick velour mouthfeel. The taste is bitter dark malty coffee, a bit acrid, roasty with some vanilla beans and possibly a touch of cacao. This is a beast of a coffee beer, for those who like it dark grab a bottle and I doubt youll be disappointed.
12 oz bottle poured into a snifter..dark brown with thin tan head..aroma of coffee,roasted nuts..tastes of coffee,roasted nuts..cant really taste the vanilla but still very good.
Black pour, nice brown head. Very roasty aroma, big coffee, chocolate, flavor of coffee, chocolate, booze, bit of vanilla. Thick mouthfeel, light carbonation, boozy finish. Awesome.

Pours black with a light brown head which leads a medium density brown foamy layer on the top. Aroma is dominated by roast coffee with some raisins and prunes in the background. Taste is bitter coffee initially, then mildly sweet accents follow before the long bready finish. Medium-to-full bodied with a texture in between creamy and oily.

Poured from bottle....pour is black with a huge creamy head...nice sticky lacing....nose is vanilla and coffee...mouth is the same with a smooth alcohol finish...very nice nutty aftermath...really nice imperial porter...
From a bottle. Pours thick and black, delicious vanilla aroma, rich dark chocolate flavours with a warming finish. Absolutely fantastic.

Wow, I dont know where I go wrong on this beer. Instead of coffee and vanilla I taste coffee grounds and peanut butter. And I know peanut butter porters are a thing, but thats not what I thought I had poured here. I had a clean palate before drinking. To be fair, I like subtle coffee beers and this was anything but. On the plus side, the texture is fantastically creamy.

Aroma exquisito. Bien concentrado y con notas potentes. Destacan los aromas a chocolate, café, maltas tostadas y Vainilla, todos bien integrados.

En apariencia, color prácticamente negro. Cuerpo redondo, carbonatacion baja. Corona de espuma media de buena retención y muy consistente.

En boca es suave, equilibrada, y con finales muy bien logrados.

Al paladar es algo compleja pero a la vez fácil de beber. Muy equilibrada en cada momento, y es que a pesar de sus 60 IBUs, en ningún momento se percibe un intenso amargor, ya que el dulzor de la malta se hace presente sin sobresalir. El final es exquisito, notas a café, chocolate y Vainilla se perciben incluso tiempo después del trago.

En resumen es una excelente cerveza. Aromas y sabores bien conjuntados. Un excelente equilibrio entre dulzor de la malta y amargor del lúpulo. Las notas a chocolate, café y Vainilla no empalagan, sino al contrario, se complementan, y cada trago te deja con ganas de continuar. Simplemente excelsa.

Appearance: deep near black, with a short, creamy light tan head. Aroma: big coffee nose, with dark chocolate and vanilla underneath.  Taste: 	espresso, bitter dark chocolate, sweet cream and vanilla, wet wood, light booze, some caramel, and a little earthy, piney hops.  Finish: 	lingering smooth bittersweet chocolate and vanilla, with a hint of lasting coffee roast. Notes: 	Full and silky, big, sweet, roasty, and a little boozy. A bottle for sharing.  Gift from Josh in exchange for a bottle of Roger Meade Clynes Mexican Moonshine.

Medium/strong aroma with roasted malts, vanilla and licorice. Black reddish color and medium/strong white brown head. Strong taste with dominating coffee flavors. Dark chocolate, roasted malts and some alcohol. Very balanced. Medium/long aftertaste with roasted malts and some hops. Medium/full body and soft carbonation. Overall high quality, though the amount of coffee doesnt fit for my taste. Body could also be more full.
Pours a black brown color with a foamy off white head. Notes of smoke, dark chocolate, coffee, brownie and earth. Very good
Pure coffe heavh, French roast, slight Valhalla, some toffe richness, flavor and aroma, great balance for a big brew. Fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 Bottled. Pour into a snifter, pitch black with a quickly dissipating large tan head. Aroma is tons of coffee. It just pours out of this beer. Vanilla is nonexistent to me. Chocolate is more prominent. Amazing smell. Flavor is just an incredible amount of coffee. And I get pepper maybe like a Mexican hot chocolate. Not sure I get any vanilla, Coffee bitterness finish. This beer is full bodied and yet still silky smooth.

22 oz bottle. Pours dark brown black with a big creamy tan head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is huge roast coffee with fudgy malts and a little vanilla.

The flavor is a little more subdued than expected. Lots of roast coffee, chocolate malt and vanilla with a big bitter roast finish. The mouthfeel is medium bodied and slightly watery.

Overall, a very nice coffee porter with nice chocolate and vanilla notes.

On tap at Global brew. Pours a very dark brown or black with a resilient tan head. Aroma of a cold pot of coffee. Taste is dark roasted malt, fresh ground coffee, black strap molasses, vanilla and prunes. Bitterness evident from roasted grains and ABV comes through after the swallow.

355ml bottle. Black colour with small to average, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, tan head. Roasty, dark malty aroma, a plethora of coffee notes, cedarwood, Grandpas cigar box. Taste delivers identical flavours. Excellent coffee - excellent beer. I dont find (and dont miss) the vanilla.
Bomber to giant snifter. Dark brown with thick tan head. Luscious coffee flavor with silky vanilla finish.

Bottle. Pours black with a lingering creamy tan head with lacing. Smells like a roasted vanilla latte. The taste is coffee, vanilla, caramel, chocolate, and roasts. The palate is medium bodied with a certain smooth creaminess that finishes with coffee. Great beer!

Kólaszínű italunk tekintélyt parancsoló, keskeny és sima bézs habbal köszön be, majd ezeréves fa háncsának fekete földből előásott illatmolekulái lopóznak elő ódon rejtekükből, s ha mindez kevés lenne, a bársonyos kávé és isteni vanília párosának utánozhatatlan aromái garantáltan a "10 pontos" kategória irányába mutatnak. Sötét ízei magával ragadó mélységekbe vezetnek, a földes-fás, keserű csokoládés jegyek mennyei krémességben találnak egymásra, a mogorva hangulatok és a legnemesebb vanília selymességének látszólagos ellentéte tökéletes harmóniában olvad össze. A vanília szerkezete egyébként nagyszerű finomsággal jelenik meg, molekuláit egyszerre érezzük a szánkban és szaglójáratunkban. Mindehhez egy vaskos mennyiségű komló csatlakozik végszóra; hatalmas robajjal búcsúzik a fenevad.

Initial aroma of coffee with sugar. Initial taste of vanilla coffee with cocoa. Rich full creamy mouth feel. Great in small quantiles. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bomber - pours midnight black with a light tan head. Huge coffee aroma with notes of chocolate, roasted chestnuts and vanilla. Big bold flavors explode with layers and complexities. Coffee dominates, while vanilla, roasty char, caramel, smooth milk chocolate give it character. The 10% ABV is nearly undetectable amongst this deliciously complex porter.

A richly complex and dessert-y beer that doesnt overpower with sweetness. Near black. Full flavors of roasty-toasty malts with really nice vanilla, and equally nice coffee. A bit of bittering hops wind down the finish with dark and pale dried fruts (swear a hint of dry apricot/peach.) Amazingly balanced and delivers it all up front with a manageable palate, some warming alcohol... ohh that damn peach schnapps hiding in there. Wonder if that is the hops. Drinkable for the fullness. Exceptional!

Aroma is obviously coffee and roasted malts, theres no discussion there. The taste is perfected by the coffee and vanilla, but I have to say that it is not too much of it. Theres just the perfect amount so it doesnt take over or make it harsh. Its the other way around actually and the outcome is a perfectly balanced porter with a smooth body and a pretty soft aura. This is near perfection and I can do nothing more than recommend it to anyone who knows how a good porter should taste. If you dont know, just buy a few and be schooled.

Bottle, thanks Eddan. 

Black with a nice tan head. On the sweet side with coffee, "milk", chocolate and vanilla. Smooth and with a full body. The finish was long. A tasty one.

Almost black beer with a beautiful, dense, big and light brown head. The nose has coffee, some strawberries that gives the freshness, some vanilla and chocolate. The great aroma. Taste has rich of malts, strong coffee, vanilla, quite strong bitterness. Roastiness and throat warming richness in the end. Medium+ bodied, smooth carbonation, slippery to drink. Strong coffee with some vanilla, brilliant beer.

Being a fan of coffee infused styles it always takes a good bit to impress me anymore, but this stuff is quite impressive. It reminds me of the first time I had Bells Java or Founders Breakfast... being smacked with a fantastic coffee/roasted presence. Layers of raspberry, vanilla and chocolate come through as well making the decadence of this 10% brew worthwhile. Ive had lots of great beers from Cali to be sure, and as true as that may be, none of their stouts or porters could ever hold a candle to some of the Midwestern takes (especially Michigan. No idea what the deal is but they are masters of the stuff). This... this however certainly does and is a top contender of coffee infused brews. Such a great brewery.

Bottle, opaque black body, skiff of foam, nice lace. Aroma is coffee and vanilla, faint dark fruit. Taste follows, with big coffee flavor. Finish is bitter sweet. Palate is fairly rich, carbonation moderate.

This beer makes me understand why dark beers rate so highly. Perfect balance of coffee, vanilla and bitterness. Comfortably the best porter I have tried (haven't had a whole lot). Get it in and around!
Pours a black color with no head retention and minimal lacing. Smells chocolatey and of vanilla. Tastes like vanilla, caramel, coffee. This is an excellent porter.....possibly the best Ive ever had.

Bomber. Strong coffee aroma with notes of vanilla and roasted malt. Pours black with a thick, creamy light brown head and some lacing. Starts with good roasted malt and nice vanilla flavor. Finishes smooth with strong coffee flavors that stick to the palate and linger for a good bit. The initial flavor was quite good but not a fan of all the coffee in the finish.

Bomber from whole foods. Pours jet black with nice tan head. Nose is coffee, vanilla and roasted malt. Taste is big vanilla and coffee. Not much bitterness but just enough to counter the sweetness from vanilla. Creamy mouthfeel. Well done really enjoyed this.

Look: pours very dark in the center. Little comes through on the edge of the glass. Tan head.
Smell: roasted coffee. Chocolate. Roasted malts. Smoke almost like sitting next to a campfire. 
Taste: tastes like cold coffee. Very roast malts. Huge bitterness from the coffee. 
Feel: sweet from what I think is vanilla but heavy coffee flavor overwhelms everything else.
Overall: ok beer. Not my type of Porter. Would like see more vanilla, just seems overwhelmed by the coffee.
First drank: home 1/3/15 
Vintage: 2014

Pours a dark black with thick dark brown head. A strong of aroma of fresh coffee beans. Taste is fantastic with a rich coffee taste and hints of vanilla and grains. A slightly dry aftertaste from the malts and grains.

The coffee is strong with this one! Pour is dark, dark brown. Nearly pitch black. Khaki head with the most excellent lacing. The aroma is immediately coffee up front, with chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, caramel. Taste is sweet vanilla, coffee, chocolate, and a mild hop bitterness. It has a luxurious mouthfeel, thick and soft. Very nice beer.
Pretty near perfect creation. Fantastic balance of the coffee malts and hoppy bitterness in a creamy finish.
