Growler pour. Thank you Justin for sharing. Pours black with a big tan cream head. Big coffee bean aroma. Coffee bean flavor with a nice vanilla, caramep, and chocolate smooth blended flavor. Finishes smooth roasted malt flavor and coffee. Fun beer. Great stuff.

Pretty much black, with a caramel colored head. Aroma is primarily coffee, but has a vanilla edge with a hint of cardboard. Wow, this could easily pass for an espresso beverage with alcohol, rather than the reverse! Beautiful coffee, with just the right balance of acidity and sweetness. $6/22oz

Poured from a growler.....two days after brought back from bar. Pours dark with a nice kaki head and good lacing throughout. Nose is an incredible coffee smell along with some sweetness. Taste is strong coffee and chocolate leading to a nice bitter aftertaste. Very good beer, and one I will be trying again.

On tap at POUR. Beautiful cocoa nose with coffee, lactose, and sweet character. Dark black opaque with creamy lacing tan head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Sweet with cocoa, coffee, and lactose - balanced nicely with nutty and hoppy bitter components. Roasted flavors. Sweet lactose and rich nutty sweet finish with lingering cocoa-coffee sweet after.

Pours black with a nice looking light brown head. Nose is beautifully balanced coffee beans, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is so good. Espresso, vanilla, milk chocolate. Mouthfeel is like an affogato crossed with a regular ice-coffee. Subtle booze. Balanced. Unbelievably good

bottle. black under a large foamy brown head. robust black coffee and sweet vanilla and caramel in aroma. vanilla hits the tongue immediately followed by a cream sweetness. undertones of black roasted malts and bitter dark coffee. silky, full bodied. drinks like its much less than 10%. worth the hype!

Bottle. Jet black pour. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, rich malt. Very round, full vanilla taste set against a nice, well-balanced porter base. Some chocolate and rich malt. Starts off very smooth, but gives way to some coffee bitterness and leaves a lingering dryness.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Smell of coffee, vanilla, loaded with it, some hops are in there too, and milk chocolate. Upfront its quite dry, coffee and vanilla additions seem to carry the beer a lot, and seem to be the main flavour component, more caramel malt than roasted, but still very very good, its dry and quite hoppy, super drinkable and very well balanced.
Backlog. 22 oz bottle shared from Applejack. Smooth, rich and earthy with mild coffee notes, vanilla, light crispy bitterness and light caramel. Rich, robust and fucking awesome. Wow.
A favorite. Great nose. Smooth on the tongue. Awesome. Gives a really nice nose and lingers on the tongue.

Sehr dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit einer schönen bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach viel Kaffee, Röstmalz und Vanille. Geschmack sehr schokoladig, viel Kaffee, eine Menge an Vanille, einfach unglaublich!
Pours a black color with nice tan foamy head that lingers. Aroma dark chocolate vanilla roasted malt. Taste is chocolate vanilla roasted malt and some dark fruits.

Bottle from saveur-biere. Color is dark dark and head is thin persistent and beige. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Some tartness also. Aroma is super coffee, vanilla, roasted and vanilla. Some alcohol warmth in the finish.
Grand Slam. Ball last point rocks. Love the vanilla kick in the beer. Perfect amount of coffee!

A near-perfect coffee imperial stout. Huge chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and caramel flavors, all held together with robust roasted malt and some hops so its not TOO sweet. Pretty strong vanilla presence, which I dont always like but is well balanced by the coffee here. A perfect beer with most desserts or even alone as a nightcap sipper in the wintertime.
Great choice. Delicious coffee bean aroma, made me want to just smell it rather than drink it. Vanilla and coffee flavours very rich and strong.
Aroma is chocolate, vanilla. Flavor is same plus some burn sugar, green pepper, and a lingering roastyness. Sweet mid-palate but dry on the finish. SUPER!

Not a huge fan of coffee porters, but it won me over. Super mocha/carmely, creamy aroma, absolutely delightful. Color is an impenetrable black with a light amber head. Tastes almost just how it smells, a little more coffee comes through; no boozy flavor whatsoever. Perfect for a wintery beverage to sip on through the morning or night.

22oz bottle poured into a cervoise. The aroma is initially fresh coffee beans which turn towards a roasted coffee / mocha character. This is followed by briefly by fresh baked chocolate chip cookies with a notable vanilla and caramel characters. The coffee beans come back later as a secondary note to the vanilla and caramel. It pours a dark, opaque blackish color with hints of oily, burnt caramel around the edges, and is topped by a brown-orange frothy head that retains a thick ring and big, poofy island, as well as an abundant, dense lacing. The taste is a medium high sweet and medium high bitterness, nearly balanced, but its definitely a stronger bitter. The slick and thick texture has a creamy carbonation with a touch of prickliness. The full body starts out with smooth syrupy caramel flavored with vanilla. Then some cookie-like sugariness comes through and it finishes with espresso bitterness and a woody, gritty quality. The coffee character lingers, turning more towards coffee grounds, with hints of vanilla coming in and out.
Enjoyable coffee imperial porter. Tasty and smelly. Of greatness. This beer stands out above the rest.

Bottled. Thanks Noize for the share. The aroma has big vanilla and moccha. Black coloured beer with a thin,beige head. The taste is sweet, slightly bitter, has moccha, vanilla, toffee, some roast. Very full and tasty. Great desert beer. I just dont like it when they talk about Imperial porter. It is nonsense, just the same as imperial stout.

12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Aroma of roasted coffee with hints of vanilla. Pours a pitch black with minimal tan head that dissipates rapidly. Flavor is very smooth. Very creamy and coffee like. Alcohol is masked extremely well. Great beer, would suggest....its up there with Bells java stout.

[5915-20131010] 650mL bottle. Chocolate roast and light vanilla wood aroma. Black body with a quick foamy mocha head. Chocolate roast and bitter coffee malt flavour. Full body. Delicious. (10/4/8/4/16) 4.2
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, Greg Clow, jercraigs, mds)

Pours jet black, smelling strongly of coffee beans with a small tan head. "Robust" is one way of putting it, extreme taste of coffee up-front with a sweet vanilla taste after. Notes of malt, earthy grain and dark chocolate. Its very good but that comes with a powerful taste, also if you don’t like coffee I doubt you would enjoy this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from the bottle into a snifter. Pours a dark brown/black with a beautiful creamy dark tan head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, chocolate, tobacco, and caramel. Taste is the much the same with a nice subtle hop presence to it. Medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a velvety mouth feel. A very robust full flavored beer with a nice dryness in the end, Outstanding!

Bomber to a tulip. It pours nearly jet black with a huge beige head that takes a whlile to shrink down, leaving nice lacing. Aroma is dark roast coffee, vanilla bean, and chocolate. Very nice. Taste is coffee, cream, vanilla bean, rich chocolate, cocoa, and roasted dark malt flavors. Mouthfeel is very creamy and sticky. It leaves a fantastic aftertaste that reminds me of a good cappuccino. One of the best beers Ive had this year, outstanding.
22 oz bottle. Aroma: malty, boozy, and roasty, with hints of vanilla, coffee, burned caramel, licorice, molasses, and toffee. Taste/Palate: sweet and crisp; finishes astringent and bitter.

Poured from a 22. Aroma has a strong but pleasant coffee aroma with hints of vanilla. Flavor has a strong but not overpowering coffee taste to it. It is sweet and creamy, almost like a coffee ice cream. After taste is not bitter at all. Very pleasant and well balanced.

12 oz bottle pours dark brownish black. Heavy on the coffee aroma with a hint of vanilla. Taste is mostly coffee with some oak and burned toast. No vanilla flavor. Not as smooth as I want. Some age could remedy that. I expected a little more. Not bad though.

Bottle 65 CL at Pikkulintu. Pours black brown with brown head and a vanilla scent. Notes of vanilla, coffee, licorice, roasted malts, chocolate cake. Very nice vanilla taste. Smooth easy drinkable with loads of taste.- beerbasher

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Black, light tan head. Vanilla chocolate, coffee mudcake. Roasty soft delicious nose. Med bodied, well hidden abv. Dry chocolate, vanilla pods, smooth nice intensive. Real nice intensive soft sweet drinkable ris.-- bb

Pours jet black with a big foamy tan head. Nose of coffee. Full bodied with creamy smooth mouth feel. Flavor is super rich with a tone of chocolate malts and coffee. Vanilla too.  Finished bitter chocolate. Super beer. Loved every drop.

bottle in a trade thanks to cunningham! shared with a friend. poured dark block with a nice caramel head. the vanilla jumps right in your face! strong dark coffee, vanilla, caramel, dark roasted malts, milk chocolate, really tasty stuff! loved it!

Pours a dark brown with a khaki head. Aromas of loads of coffee, vanilla and licorice with some chocolate. Taste of coffee and vanilla the little hop bitterness at the end. Medium body on the mouth feel. Nice lacing on the glass. Overall a very good Porter a little bit of alcohol burn at the end also as the beer warms up.

22oz bottle pour. Phenomenal - from the first sniff to the last sip. Big notes of roasted chocolate and huge swathes of vanilla pervade the nose and the taste. Beautiful tan foam head on the pour, with a medium body and mouthfeel. This is stellar. The coffee notes are not acrid at all - but provide a good dose of body and kick to this imperial porter. Booze is hidden at 10% - goes down almost too well here. This is a beer I have had my eye on for a while and it was worth the wait.

From San Diego. Pours opaque black. Small tan creamy-looking head. Fizzy watery lacing. Smell is overpowering coffee and vanilla, some dried fruit and dessert wine in the background. Taste is also of overwhelming coffee and vanilla. Milk chocolate, a little acidic sharpness, very bitter. Body is thin, slightly acidic, smooth. Tastes unlike any other stout/porter I've had - it's big and complex but the strong coffee and especially the vanilla makes it almost un-beer-like. Agree with HKdIPA that it's almost like a bitter beer version of a Kahlua.

Bottle from San Diego via G&M. Thick black pour with dense fine tan head. Aroma is unusual - the vanilla is a big change from most imperial stouts/porters. Lots of coffee and lots of woody vanilla. Maybe too much vanilla. Taste follows. Vanilla is very powerful - somehow makes it more chocolatey too which is good - probably a bit too much for my liking. That said, good to try a big stout/porter that takes things in a new direction. Tastes a bit like a beer version of Bailey's. Good amount of hoppy bitterness and a lot of booziness. Really interesting beer. Not my favorite but good to try something so committed to a different take.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. Pours black with a massive foamy tan head. Aroma is lightly toasted grains and a bit of cocoa. Taste is similar and wow! Vanilla, roasted chocolate and coffee quite clear as day. Truly wonderful and everyone should try it.
A full body porter with a strong coffee flavor. A very hearty and enjoyable selection.
Vihreä Haltiatar 11/2014. Very fine beer. Lots of coffee, chocolat, warming roasted malts, some alcohol and well balanced hoppiness. Wonderful.

Pours dark as a starless night with an excellent massive head. Lacing and retention are also excellent. Nice nose of sweet dark chocolate over coffee with strong vanilla notes. Medium body with a slick texture that has creamy aspects, but is not quite there. Above average carbonation with effervescence present from the middle on. The flavor profile is simply a masterpiece - intense, complex and balanced. It begins with a rush of sweet dark chocolate that highlights the vanilla aspects but also has a distinctive caramel presence. As the sweetness fades, coffee becomes evident and the vanilla becomes more note like and the caramel is most noted. The middle is the only detection of roast I encountered, and it is buttressed by hop flavor (rind like) and bitterness. A combination of alcohol, hops and coffee yield a nice puckering effect. The finish is quite smooth and lingers with an abundance of all the previous flavors. It is the most complex finish Ive had the privilege to experience. The finish is where the 10% alcohol becomes evident as a very slight nice burn at the back of the throat. This one is World Class, the best porter Ive ever had and its rating is second to only FBS. IMHO, this is the best porter in the world.

On tap at Ballast Point Tasting Room. Pours dark black with a thin tan head. Aroma is all coffee with some roast. Flavor is dark espresso roast. Finishes sticky on the mouth. Really nice beer. Holy cow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 660 ml. Pitch black with tiny beige head. Aroma: amazing vanilla touch, coffee, chocolate, nuts, malt and a tad of alcohol. Awesome mix, but the taste is even more impressive. Robust beer, full bodied. Pleasant warming feeling. Among the best in the style.
Dark brown, almost black, colour with a large brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and liquorice. Same taste. Full bodied.

Aroma: Burnt Coffee, Dark Chocolate

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Brown Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Burnt Coffee, Dark Chocolate, Mild Vanilla

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Drying

Pours black with a massive foamy and noisy tan head. Aroma is lightly toasted grains and a touch of cocoa. Taste is wow! Vanilla, roasted chocolate and coffee. Truly wonderful. Made quite an impression.

0,65l bottle @ Pikkulintu. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee with a hint of vanilla. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, alcohol and hops. Wow! Exquisite!

Black pour with a brown head. Aroma was very light; coffee, toasted malt, and just a tiny bit of vanilla. Flavor is 10x stronger than aroma, very bold coffee notes and rich dark chocolate with a bit of vanilla at the end.

aroma is vanilla, coffee. Black appearance with a dark brown heading. Kind of bitter-ish taste with a heavy oily body. Soft to medium carbonated.
Overall a really good looking and tasting beer.

650ml bottle. Black pour, brown head. Coffee is abundant in the aroma. Im not a huge coffee lover but high marks for delivering on its promise. Its mixed in with a chocolatey, nutty roastedness. No vanilla as of yet though. Taste is more bold coffee and this time the vanilla meshing with it. Chocolate brownie midway through. Ending with coffee bitterness. I can see why this is so highly rated.

Draught at the Argonaut, Washington, DC. 
Pitch black colour with a small tan head. 
Roasted malt, spices, pepper, chili, mild sweetness and vanilla in the aroma. 
Very roasted malty flavour with ashy dryness, coffee and chili warmth. 
Rich, heavy and tasty.

22 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Pours a deep, dark brown, verging on black. Once in the glass, no light whatsoever filters through the brew - it almost seems as though light rays that stray too close are sucked in and absorbed. A thick, fluffy dark tan head forms and hangs around for a while, slowly dying down to a cap and ring which leave clumps of lacing on the glass.

S: The aroma opens with dark, dark, dark roasted grain, not unlike burned bread, wreathed through with black coffee-espresso to form a miasma of the color black. Underlying that is a sort of earthen bitterness.

T: Oh, that thick, heavy, blunt, blackened roasted grain! The flavor opens with a veritable club of blackened, burned bread and grain, with traces of smoke and char. Unfiltered dark roast coffee takes not merely center stage, but also left, right, and the orchestral pit at times. There are notes to the flavor quite reminiscent of burnt firewood or campfire ashes, mixed with the scorched earth from the bottom of a firepit dug in the deep woods. Vanilla is hinted at, bringing no sweetness along with it whatsoever, not unlike sipping extract right from the bottle. Alcohol heat comes in during the bitter, slightly astringent finish.

M: Thin, far thinner than one might expect for a brew this heavy, dark, flavorful, and high ABV. It verges on watery at times as it moves across the palate.

O: While Id have preferred a little more malt sweetness to come through the blackened flavorstorm, and a little more body and heft to the feel, this is definitely a tasty example of an imperial porter!

Souvent croisé sur mon chemin. Cette fois-ci, en bouteille de 12 onces. Un porter qui devient presque noir une fois bien installé dans mon verre. La mousse brune a un certain panache. Une dentelle se déroule entièrement. Le nez intense de chocolat, de café et de vanille laisse aussi voir du caramel, de la mélasse, des noix et de la guimauve légèrement brûlée. En bouche, le café amer très fort fabrique des notes pimentées. Le chocolat noir assure une amertume de haut calibre. La vanille vient détendre les impressions de torréfaction et de charbon de bois. Lalcool est complètement caché. Les houblons contribuent, avec le café, à la contention des sucres maltés. En bouche, le liquide montre un corps rond. Le pétillement, ajusté vers le haut, participe à la gestion de la buvabilité. La texture est crémeuse et soyeuse. En finale, les houblons résineux se chamaillent avec un café qui souhaite établir sa suprématie. Complètement délicieux. Jaime beaucoup. Je dirais même plus, jaime trop. Ce truc complètement robuste, complexe et cohésif est si facile à boire.
Taster... Dark brown pour with off white foamy head... Strong coffee aroma... Flavors of a Starbucks iced coffee... Very nice !!!
Wow, just wow. Black gold. Chocolate and coffee,slick and oily. Campfire, burnt toast and coffee. Molasses, yum....

Aroma: intense coffee, vanilla, some chocolate and cacao. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: vanilla ice cream coming up, sweets intensify, coffee, dark chocolate, toasted malts, very light bitters in the long finish. Overall: incredibly nice Imperial Porter, not too strong, very subtle, extremely complex. Pint at Ballast Point Brewery, San Diego.
Beautiful dark ruby black, dark tan head. Aroma is coffee and vanilla. Taste is massive coffee and creamy vanilla, with lots of chocolate as well once the temp warms up. Very very good.

wowzas, this is a very strong coffee flavored porter. you can taste teh coffee grounds in this one. finished with a bitter coffee flavor. slight chocolate notes to the nose. had a draft pour at world of beer. pours black with a thick tan head.

Holy Java! I can taste the coffee in my colon! Its like a coffee enema. Its like Starbucks and Anna Nicole Smith rolled into one. Coffee aroma and flavor was off the hook. When it came to the flavor it was chocolate too. This Black beer didnt have much head after being drawn from OBriens but I didnt hold that against it. What a great beer. Wonderful. Is this considered Baltic Porter or does Porter cover it.... Anyway, what a great beer! Did I already say that? Huh must be the 12%... I asked the server for cream and sugar and a cardboard sleeve. I guess I will be here instead of Starbucks tomorrow morning. What a great Beer.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 (tap) clear very dark reddish brown colour with a tall brown head; aroma of coffee, roast; dry, intense balanced flavour with a long strong bitter finish

Oh Boii..
Pour pitch black, with a small Khaki head.
Aroma has tons of coffee, plenty and plenty of vanilla, some roast, bitter choco, cacao powder. Jeez this is slick.
Taste is actually somewhat dry, with very slight sweetness, and a heavy dose of bitterness. 
Medium n sticky body, with a fizzy (to the style) carb. Ye!!!

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 22 oz bottle, couldnt find a date, but i purchased it about 13 months ago- Pours black with a thin mocha colored head. Aroma is roasted coffee, nice espresso beans, vanilla and roasted malts. The taste is velvety smooth, coffee and vanilla really shine, roasty and delicious, bone dry finish which is interesting. Body is full and carbonation is medium. I was expecting to give this lower than the average, 100/100 is almost unheard of, but this is quite good. Just casually looking at the bottle I noticed a enjoy by date on the bottom of the label, it says 01/02/14, how does a beer of this caliber even have a expiration date? 10 months expired and it tastes fantastic, I dont understand how they date beer sometimes.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a beautifully deep brown-nearly black color with a huge billowy brown colored head. The head just sits there and persists, very slowly fading over time to leave one fantastic level of streaky lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  Oh man there is a whole lotta coffee in this smell. A huge coffee aroma greets the nose with it being accompanied by tons of vanilla and caramel sweetness. Along with these aromas are some very nice roasted malt smells as well as a moderate presence of a cocoa smell. A little bit of a woody aroma and a decent showing of a boozy smell round out the aroma profile, creating a rather sweet, dark and warming smell overall. Quite delicious smelling.
 Taste  The taste begins with tons of dark roasted malt and a sweeter coffee flavor. The sweeter nature of the brew is of a vanilla and caramel nature with just a hint of chocolate mixed within. The sweeter vanilla and caramel actually pick it up as the taste moves onto the end with the vanilla getting quite strong at the end. All the while the coffee also steps it up getting even stronger in flavor toward the end of the taste, and bringing with it a little bit of a more roasted and some more bitter flavors. While the nose displayed quite a boozy nature the taste did not display as much just giving some hints of alcohol. In the end with the mix of flavors one is left with a sweeter and rather coffee heavy roasted flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average to slightly thinner side for a 10 % brew with a carbonation level that is on the average side. Overall the feel was rather fitting as it prevented both the boozy flavors and coffee flavors from becoming too overpowering, but while still providing the base for all the complex flavors to be appropriately appreciated.
 Overall  This is a nice coffee lovers imperial porter. Big on coffee with a nice blend of roast, coffee, sweet, and booze. A very nice one to try if you get a chance.

22 oz bottle, poured into a tulip glass.

AR: Coffee and roasted malt, not sharp though.

AP: Very dark and a bit cloudy. Thick, full head with very small bubbles. Leaves lots of Brussels lace on the glass.

T: Strong, but not overpowering, coffee at the start which transforms into a malty, sweet, woody flavor in the finish with some winey character.

P: Full mouth feel, not highly carbonated, thick.

O: Really, really enjoyed this one. I am aging the other bottle and will see how it changes over a couple of years.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2015 "BIG aroma - coffee dominates the vanilla, but theyre both there, as are lots of roasted malty goodness. pours typical, maybe a touch darker than the norm for the style. man, you can smell this one comin. feel is a bit thinner than expected, but not to a fault. flavor not super complex, but super tasty. mirrors the aroma, and nearly as aggressive. coffee, vanilla, oak, roasted/burnt grain. good stuff. 2nd take 2/2011- made an even better impression. same aspects, more deliciousness! 7/11-as good or better than last time...4.4! awesome brew."

Bottle from Homer321, thank again man! Id been wanting to try this beer for awhile. Finally able. Dark brown/almost black pour with a tan head. Roasted malt aromas with lots of coffee and subtle notes of vanilla. Flavor is malty with plenty of coffee but just a kiss of vanilla. Finishes boozy though. Not nearly as robust and well-balanced as I was hoping.
Good raosty aroma. Flavor great balance of coffee and roast malt. Nice earthy hops. Slight roasty bitterness and great bitternes in hop profile.

This is an exceptional beer. One of the best coffee stouts/porters I've ever tasted. 

Aroma is a big coffee nose with hints of vanilla and chocolate. 

Excellent mouthfeel. Coats the mouth

Immediately hit with coffee and vanilla on tongue. This beer has one of the stronger coffee tastes of the coffee beers I've had. Really really awesome

Overall, this is an A+. I can't imagine what Oils make this beer any better.

Bottle 0.655l at Kaisla, Helsinki. Colour is black with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavors: Chocolate, Coffee, Sweetness, some vanilla and roasted malts. Soft but maybe too sweetish.

Bottle at Kaisla. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, chocolate, licorice, hops, roasted malts and nuts. Bitter finish with roasted malts, hops, chocolate and coffee. Excellent imperial stout.

(Bottle, 0.65 l -, at Kaisla, 20140911) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had coffee, creaminess, vanilla, burnt malts and mildly fruitiness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were coffee, vanilla, ash, sweetness, fruitiness and bitterness. Aftertaste had coffee, ash and bitter. A brew with very strong coffee presence. I felt there was even too much coffee and it disturbed balance.

On draught at BeerMongers for their fifth anniversary. Deep black with dark tan head. Aroma is strong cold-brewed coffee, vanilla, and dark chocolate. Taste is more intense dark chocolate and subtler coffee, with vanilla and a hint of caramel. Finishes with a mocha aftertaste.
Pours dark dark brown, almost black. Smell is smoky with strong coffee. Taste is coffee, vanilla, roast malts. A little thin on palate. Really nice porter.

Bottle: Thanks Hackobock: Served in a shaker:
Black body with a small beige brown head.
Aromas of vanilla, coffee roast, malt roast, chocolate, marzipan, coal, chalk, caramel and nut toast.
Flavours of bitters, coffee roast, coffee bitters, malt roast, malt bitters, dry, herbal roast, vanilla, some marshmellow tones that are just slightly noticeable, coal and coal dry bitters.
Aftertaste is stong bitter, some roast, roasted malts and oat with some coffee and dry herbal roast.
Low carbo, creamy bitter dry mouthfeel, full bodied and a creamy dry texture.
Very good, a strong crazy but beauty in its style!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: bottle, shared at the american stall at the berlinerbierfest 2013. close to black but on a very sunny day some purple showed around the edge of the glass; loads of espresso in the aroma with some cocoa; vanilla cream sweetness with plenty of roasted bitterness - coffee especially. complex, warming and invigorating

Bottle purchased at One Stop Market. Dark black with thin white head. Aroma is vanilla bean strong with light coffee hints. Nice.  
Flavor is coffee first followed by a nice roasted malt character. The vanilla bean lingers well after the sip. Medium body with a bitter / dry texture. Chocolate milk that lingers in the body.Solid but I guess this bottle has a bit of age on it because the coffee bean is starting to get bitter and acidic.

Bottle from systembolaget. Smell is smokey with a high tone of espresso coffee. Pours dark brown with a rich brown head. Taste is rich in flavour. Coffe, dark chocolates and some raisins. Palate is a bit thin compared to an otherwise complex and rich beer. Overall a good beer and a respectful porter.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark brown, almost black, colour with a large brown head.
Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, liquorice, caramel.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, vanilla, liquorice, alcohol, caramel, coffee.
Pours black with a brown head . Nose of coffee and vanilla. Taste is coffee and roasted malt with hints of vanilla and dark chocolate. Dry slightly bitter finish. Good porter

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head! Aroma of raw roasted coffee beans and sick raw bourbon vanilla right on yo face! Also some dark dried fruits, roasted malts, a woody and almost sawdusty feel to it along with some cocoa beans and smooth oatmeal. Taste is sweet and bitter with lots of roasted notes, vanilla, coffee, dark bitter chocolate and smooth oatmeal. Very very balanced and stunning porter!

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a big, brown frothy head. Aroma is huge vanilla, coffee, strong roast, Sweet berries, and almost some banana. Vanilla ice cream and some wood. Taste is really nice and well balanced! Dry chocolate, vanilla, slightly oatmealish, which rounds the sharp roast off in a great way. Dry coffee in the back. Very exclusive and well balanced.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, and lots of it, plenty of chocolate, vanilla, a bit of roasted malt, and some sugars. Taste is sweet, with plenty of vanilla and minimal bitterness. Lots of chocolate throughout. Alcohol is characteristically well covered by the flavor. Body is not all that heavy. Easy drinking for its size. Dangerous.

On my second and final flight of beers at The Hopping Pig, San Diego on 18th March 2014.

Black, with a lasting beige head, texture was creamy. Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. The taste follows along with the roasted maltiness imparting chocolate and coffee like in the nose, it is more bitter in the mouth though. The alcohol is noticeable but it adds to the overall enjoyment of this very drinkable brew.

Color negro con reflejos caobas y densa espuma beige. Aromas de café dulce y vainilla. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce de vainilla bastante intenso que se une a un toque de café, aun dulce, para acabar con un amargor, tostado resinoso y seo. Muy rica.

Pours black with little to no head out of bottle. Excellent aroma of roasted cocoa, hazelnut, and vanilla. Flavor is full of chocolate with hint of roasted coffee and nuts. A little vanilla at the finish. Great beer overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, bought @ Systembolaget, Hyltebruk. Pours deep black with a lovely, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma is stunning, chocolate, hazelnuts, coffee, vanilla, a hint of spicy chili. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and creamy and a tad light (in a pleasant way). Flavour has stunning coffee, soft smoke, luscious chocolate, light vinious, light vanilla. Great balance. balance

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours pitch black with a firm tan head. Nose is heavy roasted coffee, sweet vanilla and chocolate. Taste is huge. Powerful fresh espresso hit upfront. The sweet vanilla and chocolate notes round it off wonderfully. World class beer.

22 oz. bottle from Slicks Liquor in Vista. Huge aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, resin, caramel, molasses, and liquorice. Pours black with a thick, creamy, tan head that lasts and leaves chunky lacing. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, has a slight mineral aftertaste, a bit too astringent. The coffee is a big presence, kind of dominates the aroma and flavor. This is a good one occasionally but its really aggressive and bitter, a sipper. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation, and long, sweet/bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 Bottle. Very dark brown with a tan head. Heavy malt, chocolate, and sweet coffee aroma. Flavour is a terrific balance of dark malts, wood, vanilla, chocolate, and milk coffee. Starts fairly sweet but leaves off with a reasonable bitterness. A big beer. The last of a few good beers this night, Patrick passed out on the couch halfway through this. Eventually woke up startled and quaffed the rest.

Black with light brown head. Notes of liquorice root, vanilla and roasted coffee. Taste is liqourice root, nice vanilla, chocolate and a long lasting taste of espresso. Full body with a thin texture, medium carbonation with as mentioned before a long lasting espresso taste.

Bottle. Black with a medium sized light brown head. Lots of coffee, earthy, roasted malt, vanilla, hazelnut. Medium/full body, oily/creamy texture, soft/medium carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Has a hazelnut coffee character to it and serves well at breakfast though it seems to accelerate the Stella 3 headache from yesterday.
The darkness is spreading! More coffee than I remember.... Maybe this is a fresher bottle.

Dark brown/black with a good beige head. Aroma is coffee, blackcurrant, roasted nuts, cocoa, wood. Creamy mouthfeel, full bodied, roasty on the palate with a slightly warming booze finish and a hint of astringency. Taste is vanilla, roast coffee, molasses, chocolate.

Bottle share. Pours a dark brown, dark ruby edges, generous tan cap reduces to a thin rope. Aroma of roasted coffee, earth, woodiness, dark chocolate, vanilla, plum. Taste is an upfront bitterness mellowed by a sweet character. Long dry finish, sticky.

Pours a very dark black oil like color with the same type of viscosity, with tan head. Vanilla, caramel, and roasted coffee on the nose; follows onto the palate. The coffee and vanilla dominate the palate more so than the caramel note, it sort of disappears. Finishes with a nice chocolatey type sweetness.
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are vanilla, coffee, roasted malt, and chocolate - with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, fresh coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Flavor was smooth and creamy with dark bitter chocolate, roasted coffee, vanilla bean and dark roasted malts. Oily texture, med-full body, soft carbonation

Bottle. Black with tan head. Massive aroma, huge amount of vanilla and coffee, its quite insane, creme brulee with cold coffee. Similar taste, massive vanilla bomb with coffee, slightly roasty. Thick and sweet. Delicious

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with a thick khaki head. Nose is heavily roasted coffee bordering on bitter espresso notes which compliment the sweet vanilla bean and milk chocolate throughout. Not the biggest fan of coffee beers but these guys are pulling this off so far. The milk chocolate in this is silky smooth and goes hand in hand with the sweet vanilla. The coffee is everywhere and there are no sharp bitter or ashy edges. Those three major notes meld together sensationally. Sublime stuff. With a little age on this though, I dont think it shone as well as I was expecting. Quite excessively ashy through the coffee. A better beer fresh personally

Black with a thin white head. Aroma is burnt, black coffee with a bit of dark chocolate. Flavor is big, rich chocolate with a burnt, almost ashy finish. Pleasantly bitter and complex like string dark chocolate.

Wife: 4

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 650 ml bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours black with nice creamy head. Sweet aroma with roasted coffee hints. Taste of sweet vanilla with lots of bitter coffee. Could have been better balanced. 
2016-06-17 33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours black with big head.
Coffee and sweet vanilla all over aroma and the place. Very nice!

Mörkt brun, på gränsen till svart öl med gräddigt ljusbrunt skum. Kaffe, karamell och nötter i doften. Detsamma återkommer i smaken tillsammans med vanilj och choklad. Välbalanserad, smakrik porter som döljer sin alkohol väl.

Bottle. Pours black with thick creme colored head that lingers. Coffee aroma over mild carbonation. Coffee flavors with bitter chocolate finish. Very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650mL bottle 
Deep near-opaque ruby body. Holds a dense tan head.
Intense aroma; Tobacco, cocoa, vanilla pod, grainy malts, earthy spice, dark roast coffee bean, dark fruit undertones.
Seriously dense, thick body, low carbonation. Viscous, oily, luscious. 
Wow, intense coffee character! Just like munching on roast coffee beans - lots of vanilla, lots of dark chocolate. Really intense, length on the finish. Lots of bitterness, drying acrid notes, Kahlua-like finish. 
A serious coffee hit! Decedent, thick, sensational, really!

Bottle. Pours black with a tan/brown head. Aroma is coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, licorice. Taste is sweet vanilla and milk chocolate, light bitter dark roasted coffee and chocolate, finish is light roasted bitter. Medium/full smooth oily texture.

Bottle.Dark Brown colour ih off-beige head.Aroma is powerful of dark chocolate and strong coffee,with a hint of cinnamon and Vanilla,rosted and bready with good full body and long heavy taste, really tasty beer.
Bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Vanilla aroma. Very powerful vanilla and coffee taste. Really nice beer. Hides the alcohol well.

Big aroma of coffee grounds. Body is medium full and alc is hardly noticeable. Coffee Is pronounced as is hop bitterness. Sweetness is quite low in this brew, but it is just enough malt backbone to balance the hops. Basically a easy drinking dark ale that doesnt explode with alc. Coffee is the main theme, and its not as chewy, dry and acrid, or burnt as an Imperial stout.
bardzo intensywny kawowo-waniliowo-czekoladowy zapach. ciemne, klarowne, ze słabą pianą. w smaku cierpkie od kawy, alkoholu i paloności. słodkie od wanilii i słodów. do tego czekolada. genialne piwo.
Simply one of the best Ports ever brewed. Best enjoyed when aged several months. Great vanilla flavor. Drink solo. Not as enjoyable when sampled with other flavors. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber, cellar aged 1 year and shared with ck1 and my other brother. (notes say Fischmans, so perhaps it was me purchasing) Has a black pour with a tan head. Aroma has nuts and chocolate and light cherries. Taste is of bittersweet chocolate, nuts, cocoa powder and some roast. Smooth and well balanced. On a night of really good stuff, it was the best of the night.
Sample at Malmö beer- and whiskey festival. Excellent balance, powerful but not overpowering. Loads of dark chocolate, coffee, and vanilla.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2015 Dark brown with a tan coffee colored head. Roasted malt, coffee, and vanilla aroma. Sweet Roasted malt start with toffee and vanilla. Then as you swallow your palate is covered with char,  dark roasted coffee, unsweetened  cocoa.  Finish is dark coffee bitter finish. Really nice.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 650ml bottle. Nearly black body with a medium thick, compact, head. Old style coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt.

Bottle at Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival.
Dark brown coloured with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of fresh ground coffee and dark chocolate.
Roasted flavour of dark chocolate with notes of coffee.
Roasted finish of coffee.

Bottle at Hotel Iidaya, Matsumoto - shared with Mette. Pitch black - offwhite head. Lots of fresh coffee. Vanilla. Some sweetness. Roasted. Ok burned notes. Licorice notes. Some mild bitterness. Smooth body and finish.

Bottle sampled on 3/21. Best before 10/25/13, whoops. Coffee color with slight orange hue, medium creamy tan head. Smell is rich and appealing: roasted berries, burnt toffee, caramel latte, vanilla, complex malts. Taste is unified and hard to pick out individual elements, but theres coffee, plums, surprising bitterness fading into bitter cocoa powder. A little past its prime but still solid.
Bottle. Trade with Theydon_bois. Thanks. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Fresh coffee, vanilla, roast and charcoal. Smooth and soft. Dry and really tasty. Lovely.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 A joy. Smells like a hazelnut cream coffee. Not a lot of head. Very heavy nut malt coffee and vanilla. Long bitter aftertaste. Really creamy and nutty with delicious coffee without any acidity. Way bomb.

Pours jet black, smelling strongly of coffee beans with a small tan head. "Robust" is one way of putting it, extreme taste of coffee up-front with a sweet vanilla taste after. Notes of malt, earthy grain and dark chocolate. Its very good but that comes with a powerful taste, also if you dont like coffee I doubt you would enjoy this.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours deep dark brown with light tan head. Aroma of roasted coffee, malts and spices. Taste of coffee and hints of caramel. Sweet aftertaste. A very good beer.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a super deep dark brown with a layer of light tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and spice. Taste of coffee and yumminess.

Very nice choc and coffee aroma. Jet black colour with excellent thick tan head. Choc coffee and an amazing warmth. Med to heavy body with med carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours almost completely black, only a bit of light comes in through the edges. Smells of a lot of chocolate with some caramel and coffee in the back. Taste is a bit sweet up front and then turns to some coffee bitterness, really good beer
Big beer. Motor oil. Punch in face aroma and taste. Moderate bitter with prominent coffee flavor. Very good. Not my favorite style but well done.

Pours rich and dark with a nice brown head. You find chocolate, vanilla, coffee and toast in the aroma. A big hit of chocolate with nice hints of vanilla when you take the first sip. Rich mouthfeel without being overwhelming. A nice blended finish with a trace of booziness on the end.

On tap at Avery Strong Ale Festival. Appearance: dark brown-black color, brown head. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, light raisin, vanilla. Palate: full body, sot carbonation, oily texture, light bitter finish. Taste: malty sweet to a more chocolatey sweetness to a dark chocolate bitterness. Overall, great porter, very stout like. Complex and balanced well.

Pours pitch black with limited head but lots of lacing. Nose is smoke, espresso and maybe cherry. Notes of espresso, lots of vanilla, smoke, some tart cherry in there as well. Tastes are medium sweet and medium bitter. Full, somewhat oily mouth with a very long lasting smoke and bitterness. Lively carbonation.

Bomber to glass. Pours black. Aroma is strong and delicious coffee, vanilla and smoked roasted malts. Taste starts with vanilla beans and transitions to strong coffee notes. Some slight bitterness, but strong very bold flavors. Palate is thick and well carbonated.

Nice! Vanilla overpowers the coffee in the nose but reverses on the palate as the coffee becomes the dominant characteristic. Nice little change up pitch. Alcohol subtle at first as beer warms up it becomes more pronounced. Outstanding brew!
Dark color. Strong coffee flavor. Slightly bitter after taste. Overall a good beer.

Poured into a tulip from a bomber. Pours a deep black with a substantial brown head that persists and leaves good lacing. Nose is coffee and dark malt. Taste is dark roast coffee and a hint of vanilla. Delicious. Hides the high ABV well. Creamy mouthfeel which coats the tongue and lasts. Outstanding.
Kolsvart tjock med mellanstort ljusbrunt skum! Massor med kaffe, vanilj och rök i både doft och smak! Lättdrucken trots 10% Grym öl! Bäst före 2014-02-01
Bottle from City Beer, SF. Black, thin foamy light brown head. Vanilla coffee aroma. Chocolate, bitter coffee, vanilla taste. Thick full body.

Bottle. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, chocolate, and roasted barley. Appearance is pitch black with a light tan head. Good lacing. Taste follows aroma with a little warmth. Full body with medium carbonation. Overall very tasty.
Very well made beer. Lovely nose and great taste - chocolate and coffee - has an nice thickness too it.

"OOHHH MY" as George Takei would say. This was truly a treat for the senses. Poured at a perfect temperature into the tulip glass. Black as the heart of Davy Jones, this was almost to a point that I wouldnt fault someone for thinking it is a stout, the line is blurred for sure. Traditional porter aromas combined with latte or cappuccino and vanilla. Taste is the same with liquid velvet finish. Wonderful.

This is a bit two faced. there is a bitterness up front in your face, and then it gives away to a burst of rich roasted coffee and then an explosion of vanilla. I think the bitterness gets away with itself though. Said that but this is a bit good. I have this from the tap. I have this in a bottle too. Im looking forward to compere them.
Pours dark and has a caramel head. Taste has hints of coco, coffee and vanilla. This is now one of my new favorites.

Bottle 65 cl. Pours really dark, almost black in color with a small tan head. Vanilla and roasted coffee in aroma at first. Actually its a quite nice mix between these two here. Roasted coffee, cocoa powder, vanilla and a bit of dark fruity sweetness in taste. Smooth mouthfeel. Very intense roasted notes with vanilla staying upfront all the time. Excellent winter warmer, which leaves one with some nice roasted coffee and vanilla notes lingering all over.

Bottle looks really good but a bit complex. Beer in the glass deep black, nice head. Starts very strong, intense malty-roasty, some earthy notes. Notes of coffee and liquorice. Finish a bit milder, less intense malty, still soft roasty notes. Quite drinkable for its strenght. Great beer!
Very well balanced porter, the coffee and vanilla tones are blended in well and do not over power the caramel malts.

A: black with a tan head
S: dark roasts, sweetness
T: coffee, vanilla 
M: thick and slick
O: probably the best ballast point brew I've had

Bottle. This my favorite beer by ballast point. It has great vanilla undertones and good roasted malt flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Ginger Man NYC. Nearly black with mocha head. Aroma - coffee, coffee, coffee, roasted malt. Taste is roasted malts, coffee and vanilla extract. Really heavy on the coffee. Velvety mouthfeel, soft carbo. Very good coffee porter.

Sample from bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, thanks for sharing Vaiz! Pours dark brown to black with a small tanned head. Aroma has milk chocolate, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and molasses. Taste has quite some chocolate, malts, quite sweet, molasses, coffee and a soft bitterness. Over medium body, medium carbo. Nice stuff.
Very thick and left a alcohol punch in the aftertaste. Not a favorite from Ballast Point, but will continue to drink from this brewery.

Enjoyed on tap at Reggies in Chicago, IL while watching some acoustic acts, which was somewhat decent. Rated while watching a Karl Pilkington show about marriage which is downright hilarious. I didnt take tasting notes while drinking this, but remember this being exceptionally great. Appearance is a dark pitch black with a rich off white head. Aroma is potent in vanilla, chocolate, and hazelnut. Taste is also rich in hazelnut, with coffee notes and a nice dry finish with notes of roasted malt. This really was a fantastic brew that I hope to have again in the not too distant future.

Beautiful deep brown pour, with a tall, three finger thick, brown head. The smell of coffee and vanilla hit he nose from an arms length, and bringing the glass closer revealed chocolate and caramel. The taste was full of dark coffee followed by some rich vanilla and sweet chocolate, and a surprising high amount of hops. The finish was very grainy and hops and coffee lingered long. The mouthfeel was silky, and satisfyingly thick. This is a fantastic beer.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, courtesy of Vaiz. Pours a pitch black beer with a small beige head on top. Aroma is boozy, roasted malts, caramel and vanilla. Flavor is very sweet, malty, loads of red fruits and caramel. Very cloying, sticky mouthfeel. Nice sipper, awesome beer to enjoy. Long, medium sweet finish going on.

Bottle at Mr Hangovers 2014 Nieuwjaarsborrel, Den Haag, courtesy of Vaiz. Poured a clear dark brown with little life. The aroma is rich roasted malt alcohol liqourice vanilla. The flavour is strong bitter with a strong boozy alcoholic fruit vanilla palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation. A little too bitter for me but superb all the same.

Bottle shared at Nieuwjaarsborrel thanks to Vaiz. Pours dark brown with a ring beige head. Aroma of fudge, malt, caramel, vanilla, roast and coffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle @ nieuwjaarsborrel. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, etc. Flavour is chocolate, roast, burned molasses, slight metal notes. Good but somethings off.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, hosted by MrHangover. Black pour. Aroma is full roasted malts, chocolate, massive coffee, slightly boozy and licorice. Flavor is thick roasted smooth creamy goodness. Very well balanced and very full bodied. Lovely brew.

Bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel. Pours pitch black. Aroma is big chocolate, coffee, roast, toffee and caramel. Very intense. Quite sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Full bodied, quite sticky. Long chocolatey finish. Awesome.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with vaiiz nieuwjaarsborrel.
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lots of chocolate. Lovely
On tap at lures, pours black with light head and lacing. Aroma is light roast and coffee. Taste is big sweet vanilla roast with a bitter coffee finish. Well done

Black thick pour. Huge rich vanilla. Thick smooth with great coffee flavors. Smooth and roasty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with small tan head. Nose is coffee, vanilla, chocolate. Taste in a lot of coffee, with vanilla, dark chocolate, bitter on the tail end. Sweet but not overly sweet. Decent amount of carbonation. Glad the coffee is there to balance the sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Nose is full of fresh coffee, chocolate, and strong vanilla, and on the latter point a little medicinal but natural. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Taste is perhaps strongest on the vanilla, actually somewhat overdone to my taste, with a coffee and vanilla liqueur base, plenty of warmth in the chest, some roast and chocolate with caramel and malty undertones. The coffee seems very more orange-handled diner than gourmet, and the nice prickling from the extended hopping contributes too little to compensate. Light and pleasant acidity, low bitterness, and probably a bit too sweet for me to finish the whole bomber, but the alcohol is well-claimed and the syrupy medium-full body is appropriate for character. Well-executed and clean, but I dont like the recipe or conception.

Bottle. Pours a deep black color with a nice, tan head. Thick, roasted coffee aroma with a hint of vanilla. Very loud taste. Has a vanilla coffee kind of ring to it. Very potent. You can sense the power in the finish. An amazing porter.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 2011 or ?12 vintage bomber pulled from the Seal Beach Beachwood BBQ cellar. Thanks to Vito for knowing this was in stock when talking trade. Poured into a tulip. Appearance is deep opaque black with a tall tan head that eaves some patches of lace. We debated which aromas/flavors might have faded in aging and were pleasantly surprised immediately after we started. Aroma is coffee-powered with roast malt, some cocoa, and vanilla (which we though may have faded most, but was still holding its own). No astringency or strong booziness to indicate the 10% abv. Taste is off the charts, like a delicately carbonated vanilla frappuccino. Full bodied, creamy, thick, and filling texture, soft carbonation, a touch of heat and bitterness underlie a sweet finish.

Pours black with lots of great mocha head. Nice cold coffee aromas. Roasted coffee beans too. Taste is fantastic. Lots of great coffee with a nice maltiness to keep things balanced. Certainly not overly sweet and I cant find the vanilla anywhere in this... but still a great beverage.

Pours a dark brown, thin mocha head, vanishes quickly into very fine lacing. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt and booze. The coffee is dominant upfront, but the vanilla and caramel undertones work in with the malt sweetness well, muting the booze a bit in the finish. Still, I get a bit of alcohol sting in the tail end. Very good porter, albeit a big one,.
This is worth every penny. Black in color with great coffee feeling and mild vanilla. Dark chocolate in the nose. Fantastic Ale!!!

As a fan of imperial stouts but not always porters, this is a great *porter* rather than one of those porters that are good because they more resemble stouts. Has the lighter body of a porter, but there's nothing else light about it. Coffee? Definitely. (Actual coffee beans.) Vanilla? Clearly. (Actual vanilla beans.) Lots of other stuff going on, I'm sure, but I'll leave it with: a truly top-notch beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

P: Pitch black body with a cappuccino jiggly cream top. Delicate lace on edges. 

S: Robust columbian coffee, vanilla potpourri, near burnt dark malt, pumpernickel bread, no bake cookies and astringent booze. 

T/M: Huge vanilla extract presence hits the palate first then the coffee and chocolate cookies take over. Hints of smoke and charred molasses mingle with the velvety feel. Finishes semi dry with lingering espresso. Nice warming sensation. 

O: Love it. A great impy porter that showcases both the vanilla and coffee in a circus of flavors for your mouth. Its like having a cold triple shot if espresso with vanilla added. Highly recommended.

Bottle: Instantly strong notes of coffee and roast permeate the air, as soon as the cap comes off. Dark brown color with a modest tan head. The pour really ramps up the intensity of coffee in the air. Really good roast... the kind of coffee that stands up a spoon and leaves ash behind. Wicked good. Vanilla and milk chocolate come through in the flavor to smooth out the dominant coffee tones and it works. Still, such a heavy roast and ash are noticeable. I love coffee and vanilla; this pulls them off to near perfection.
Tap at rattle n hum, new york. Black color, brown head. Aroma is coffe and chocolate, full bodied flavor. Nice full roasty body, strong coffee, chocolate.

Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Good roasted malty and coffee aroma, vanilla and licorice notes as well. Flavor has layers of coffee, combined with roasted malt, vanilla and cocoa. Very smooth. Bitter finish, long with vanilla and espresso notes. Huge beer.

Really nice beer. Black pour with khaki ring. Smoky and bitter aroma, plenty of roasted coffee as well. Taste has great bitter bite complemented with some dark fruit, dark chocolate sweetness, a little hint if vanilla and burn. Almost tart kick at the end. Oily feel, definitely a sipper. Good stuff
Pours black with a lasting beige head. Tobacco, coffee and chocolate aroma. Taste is very strong with coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate. Fruit noted as well. Finish is chocolate coffee and tobacco.
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and some woody notes. Taste is medium sweet leading to a roasty finish. Amazing!

Aroma y sabor muy fuerte a cafe recien hecho. Apariencia muy buena con retencion de espuma. En sabor dulce contrastada con el amargor del cafe. No es mi favorita pero muy bien hecha. Para tomar de a poco, un poco hostigosa.

Draft at Uber in Seattle. Dark black with some brown filtered light, big thick tan foam. Dry dark coffee, some tobacco leaf. Slight smoky funk, big tartness. Lovely and rich. Bitter coffee, smoke, very nice
Dark body brown head. Aroma of coffee and cocoa. Taste is sweet with a nice coffee bitterness. Great beer
Black. Tan head. Pretty. Chocolate and tobacco. Some dark seafoam candy. Just a touch of booze, and a hint of dark fruits. Really nice.

Pours pitch-black with 0,5-finger mocca coloured head. Aroma has tons and tons of coffee, too much in my opinion. There is also little vanilla-like woodiness and hints of roots and herbs. Taste has also a lot of coffee, but not as much as in the aroma. Also licorice and chocolate are present, with almost chili-like spiciness and little vanilla. Palate is full and little sharp. Too much coffee in my opinion, which makes this very challenging to drink. Especially with a bomber.

On tap @ Chucks 85th. Pours thick inky black with a medium thin lacy mocha colored head. Aroma is roasty charred malt, vanilla, and dark coffee. Taste is rich creamy dark malt with charred oak flavors. Big notes of coffee, almond, and fresh vanilla bean are all present. Amazing rich beer, very easy drinking. Cant imagine what the bourbon barrel version of this would be like...
2013 bottle. Black pour with a tan head. Black coffee espresso aroma. Big coffee flavor with just enough vanilla notes. More coffee than in years past, but still freakin tasty.

Pours a deep brown with minimal, creamy head. Aroma of coffee and vanilla, along with roasted grains, burnt toast. Flavor is marked by the combination of vanilla and coffee, along with some licorice, some leather, a bit of caramel sweetness. This is a really nice, balanced porter and a great winter warmer type of beer.
Growler pour. Pours black with thin mocha head. Nose of green pepper, vanilla, coffee. Medium body, smooth coffee flavor, vanilla.
Aroma of dark fruits, dark chocolate and coffee. Taste is similar. Soft carbonation. Very good beer.

Close to black with a medium-sized tan head. Aroma is of coffee, vanilla, roast, smoke, and a bit of chocolate. Flavor leans towards the coffee a bit more with a bit of caramel in the finish. Alcohol is masked well.

Cant believe I had never gotten around to rating this but picked up a growler of it to start a boys weekend and it was probably the best beer (or at least best new beer) of the trip. Dark mahogany with a dark biege head. Chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, espresso froth, dry and sweet but so very finely balanced, smooth, moderate carbonation and full body, so easy to drink.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 29.12.2013, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet roasted, dark malts, espresso, dark sugar, vanilla, chocolate, grass. Taste is dark malts, sour espresso, harsh vanilla, grass, cocoa, dark sugar, almond essence. Longlasting harsh bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice enough, but very disappointing really. Taste is just too much on the sour / harsh coffee and vanilla side.

Picked up a growler of this. Pours an extremely dark brown with about 1 of mocha colored head. Once the head dissipated there was some excellent lacing. Aroma is similar to an imperial stout with strong coffee notes and roasted malt. Despite the commercial description I do not notice any vanilla. Taste follows the nose with strong coffee flavors upfront followed but a slightly bitter finish. There is just a hint of vanilla in the finish but it is not nearly as strong as I have experienced with other beers. The body is medium (this is where it really differs from a stout) and very smooth. The alcohol is hidden extremely well. Good stuff.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Nice black pour with a one inch light brown head. Aroma is coffee, coffee, and more coffee. The flavor followed suit. At first, I was disappointed that the coffee flavor was so overwhelming. Combined with the pronounced bitterness, the beer just seemed too harsh. However, as the beer warmed up, it started to reveal itself. The vanilla became quite prominent and added an enjoyable, sweet counterbalance to the coffee. By the end of the glass I was sucking it down and wishing I had more. Didn't even think about the ABV. It's not even there. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong hearty malt base, pronounced coffee aroma with strong appeal, what an Imperial should be.

Tap at Armsbys. Clear dark reddish brown with a foamy tan head. Smells of coffee, roasted malt, light chocolate and caramel. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and coffee. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep black color with a frothy light brown. Aroma is a potent roasted malt coffee character and some sweet dark caramel. Flavor is a strong burnt bitter coffee. Lighter in body for how heavy it it, with a lingering burnt bitterness. Delicious. Perfect morning wake up.
on tap at Haven Gastropub, super coffee taste, finished really smooth with just a hint of alcohol bite. Wow so much coffee, this is a wonderful tasting beer!!!
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Big beer. Black, with dark brown lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Taste is very heavy on the coffee, with very dark roasted bitterness. The barrel aged version is a bit more balanced given the additional sweetness from the barrels...

Black with small beige head.
Coffee, heavy roasted barley, ash, vanilla some chocolate.
Taste is balanced with a mild sweetness and finishes with some bitterness. (coffee, vanilla, chocolate, bitterness). Well integrated alcohol!
Really nice!

Pitch black with nice foam.
Aroma and taste is loaded with vanilla and coffee.
Great beer!

Black with brown head - Roasted malt aroma with some coffee as well - Good malt body with coffee and bitterness, and there is olso some alcohol in the back - Lingering roasted malt and coffee finish - This was good, but the alcohol heat comes a little bit to much through
Deep black body with a nice off-white head. Aroma is cofee. Taste is coffee again, chocolate and vanilla. Pily texture, medium body, lively carbonation. End is dry and coffee
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 Pours a dark black with a brown head. Very robust with excellent vanilla, coffee, and chocolate flavors. Very smooth for the high alcohol content. Well done
A strong smell of coffee with vanilla mixed it. It is black with a dark brown head. It has a rich coffee taste it has a bitter bite to it on the way down.

Very good rich and tasty imperial port that I sampled on tap at Eureka Burger in Redlands, CA. I really enjoyed the flavors of espresso and chocolate that dominate this beer and really accommodate the dark malts. Cant wait to try this porter again.

Why they call this a porter is beyond me. The is a stout compared to many stouts Ive had over time. Wonderful Spicey mouthfeel with coffee and chocolate as the main flavor. This is a wonderfully balanced "porter" that stands out among other beers. Top notch and well worth seeking out.
Black pour with small tan head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, and licorice. Flavor of more chocolate, hint of vanilla and espresso. Bittersweet thick finish with great mouthfeel. Excellent beer.

Bottle. Black with a tan head that settles to a cm and lasts well. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, white pepper, fudge, coconut oil. Quite silky, lowish carbonation. Some unintegrated alcohol. Sweet with loads of coffee, some dark chocolate, vanilla, fudge. The coffee seems surprisingly fresh with berry and spicy overtones as if freshly ground. Maybe thats partly good vanilla, but it works well anyway. Discreet bitterness and a little astringency sweep the sweetness away pretty effectively at the end. As usual for me l with this sort of thing, theres a lurking sense of "surely this is too much coffee it should be mainly beer because reasons" but it is really nicely put together and the coffees vibrant.

12/7/13. Multiple samples at valley forget beer festival. Best beer I sampled and it was actually the last beer of the night. 
Poured black with a dark brown head. 
Sweet vanilla with a dark roasted coffee. Great sweet roasted coffee. Amazing beer!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to plastic glass
Smells like a coffee crisp, coffee, chocolate, vanilla wafer. 
Deep black with a creamy tan head.
Coffee, coffee, coffee, some sweet caramel, but coffee! Too much coffee for my tastes.

Draft - Dark roast coffee and roast malts. Jet black with a rich big beige head. Coffee and vanilla are up front but not in a cohesive manor. It seems like I am doing a Imperial Stout with a coffee boiler maker. Mouthfeel is spot on.
On tap at ABR - awesome porter with great coffee aromas and some vanilla underneath. Glad to have this brewery in MN
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown with an ecrue head that has the aroma of booze and tastes like strip.g roasted coffee with a bitter after tadte

From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee and licorice. Flavors follow with a bit of vanilla and dark roasted espresso notes. Medium heavy body with light carbonation. Bitter roasted finish.

65cl bottle from SB. Black colored, dense brown head. Massive roasted malty and coffee aroma, vanilla and licorice notes as well. Flavor has layers of coffee, combined with roasted malt, vanilla and cocoa. Very smooth. Bitter finish, long with vanilla and espresso notes. Huge beer, fantastic.

Black with light tan foam. Smells of coffee and vanilla, very strong and decadent. Flavor is overpowering coffee and burnt malts. Full bodied with moderate carb and an off dry finish. Decent beer, nose>flavor

Original review on 19FEB11: 3/2.5/2.5/3.5/3- 2.73
A: Pours a dark, brown ale. single finger latte head falls quickly leaving a fine velvet sheet. Little lacing.
S: Plenty of coffee. Sharp alcoholic nose. A little overbearing with the coffee and alcohol. 
T: Once the beer hits the mouth, its all vanilla. Such a severe transition from coffee to vanilla, man I dont really dig this. Okay, a little bit later and the coffee is starting to balance out the vanilla sweetness a bit. Roasty background.
M: Thick with low carbonation. Sticky.
D: This is a big beer. I will finish the bottle, but I will never seek this out again.

Serving type: bottle

11-27-2012

Bomber. 2013 bottling. Nearly black pour, with a creamy tan head; nice lacing. Overt aromas of espresso, with layers of vanilla extract and bakers coco. Once settled, the carbonation gives a soft, creamy, full mouthfeel, with an overall medium weight on the palate. 10% very well concealed. Similar flavors of vanilla cream, coco powder and creamy espresso coat the palate... Kinda like espresso poured over vanilla ice cream, with a drizzle of chocolate. Flavors of dry, bitter coffee and dark chocolate cling to the palate. Well defined, if not a bit one dimensional.. Though still good stuff. Definitely need to be in the mood for a coffee or mocha to fully enjoy. A little more weight and concentration would take this to the next level.. Though I'm not complaining. Solid. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Growler from Whole Foods. Black and black with thin tan head. Burnt roasted coffee nose slight hint of vanilla. Flavor very burnt and roasty. Not a fan of coffee beers... too burnt and not enough complementary malt. Alcohol is well hidden tho.

On draft at the brewery. Pours black with a tan head. Strong coffee flavor, hint of vanilla, roasted malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 1/28/2013 Total Score: 4.4Strong coffee aroma and intense coffee flavor with a hint of vanilla.  Some alcohol on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My Bottom Line:
Creamy vanilla, chocolate and coffee whip up a memorable piece of cake.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam sits atop the blackness.
-These super-sweet dessert-like concoctions can only work if theyre impeccable, and this one is.
-Coffee and roasted malts add welcoming depth away from the sweetness spectrum.
-Carbonation was pleasantly fluffy.

Bottle.
22 bomber pours a jet black color with a tan head. Aromas Of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, roasted dark malt. Full bodied, incredible.

Strong hops, strong vanilla, strong coffee, high alcohol, this beer is high in everything, but it doesnt taste very good. It is like Kahlua with hops. Perhaps its appeal is to those who like lots of tastes other than good malt and hops, but it isnt very impressive.

Pours a deep dark black with minimal tan head. Aroma has a big roasty note up front, followed by rich chocolate and then the vanilla comes through, almost like vanilla iced cream. Flavor is huge on the vanilla, but almost has an extract like taste to it, roastiness follows and the chocolate character as well. Overall this is a pretty good drinking shelf turd, especially for breakfast.
Bottle 65 cl from Systembolaget. Black with a thin brown head. Coffee, vanilla, slight licorice, malty. Full body, low carbonation, bitter coffee finish. Nice!

A big bomber pour.
Typical appearance of a dark, yummy porter style.
A pleasing, warm alcohol aroma, woody smoke, cinnamon, bittersweet chocolate. I really am not getting any coffee hints, but the vanilla comes through with the alcohol....interesting.
Taste is slightly more hoppy than some other porters, but good.
Definitely some more alcohol on the finish, along with some tootsie roll sweet chocolate flavors.
This was an interesting Imperial Porter....at first, I wasnt to sure about it...just didnt quite seem to be all there, a bit off kilter maybe.
As I sat, enjoyed and rated, it became more enjoyable.
My suspicion is that this needs to be served at a bit warmer temp than some other porters for a full experience.
"It was darkly rumoured that the butler, regarding him with favour such as that stern man had never shown before to mortal boy, had sometimes mingled porter with his table beer to make him strong."
Charles Dickens, Dombey and Son, 1848

750ml bottle. If you like effervescent coffee liqueur this is the beer for you. Pours black with a minimal head thats gone in an instant leaving no lacing. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and wood ash. Taste is very lightly sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, lively to fizzy carbonation (way too much for this beer), burnt malts, bitter chocolate and a long bitter finish. Alcohol is too prominent. I generally like this sort of beer but not this one.

Chocolate and cocoa in the nose, Medium to full bodied. Lots of milk chocolate, latte, Lingering attacking bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice transition from sweet and roasted to bitter and fruity. Excellent.

Aroma: vanilla, medium roast coffee, cocoa, all in smooth succession. Appearance: espresso body, light brown and foamy head. Taste: sweet vanilla, caramel notes balanced by bitter coffee and bitter dark chocolate. palate: incredibly smooth mouth feel. creamy, like an oatmeal stout, with medium carb. mimics the texture and mouth feel of a barrel aged beer. outstanding.
Chewy, chocolatey yumminess. Complex flavors overshadowed a bit by the alcohol. Overall, an outstanding brew
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Flaska från systembolaget . Svart med beigefärgat skum. Doft av vanilj, kaffe och rostad malt. Smaken drar åt mörk choklad, kaffe och vanilj

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Aroma: wood, vanilla at the forefront, fading into coffee and roasted malts. Also present are earth and ash, while caramel tempts and waters the mouth. Theres a prickling alcohol presence, but it blends in with the other notes. The mouthfeel is sublime: perfect combination of a medium-to-viscous body and smooth carbonation. It manages to be as distant from "watery" or "overcarbonated" as it is from "syrupy." On the tongue, it is sweet without being cloying and moderately bitter; it leaves an aftertaste of burnt wood, malts, a motherload of coffee, and just a hint of vanilla. I really wanted it to be a little more vanilla-forward than it is, but then again thats asking for perfection. Its a fantastic beer as it is, and Im glad it finally got to Texas. Itll be a regular in my fridge for sure.

Pours black. Aroma of roasted coffee beans, vanilla, dark chocolate. Rich flavor: coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, berries, a little woody/smokiness too. Fairly high ABV but hidden well within the great flavor. Would have again for sure!

Pours black with a one finger mocha head that thins fast.
Aroma is huge, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, and a touch of reese peanut butter cup. Weird and awesome!
Taste is a big coffee bitter with a chocolate and vanilla finish.
Low-medium body with a low-medium carbonation.
Overall very good. Big coffee and vanilla aroma and taste. Great.
More coffee than vanilla for me out of this one. Heavy porter that needs a bit more malt to make it balanced.
Smak och doft av söt vanilj, choklad, brända toner och tydliga kaffearomer. Rund, len, med kraftfulla smaker med toner av saltlaktris och havssalt. Riktigt fin.

Intense roasted aroma with lots of chocolate. Unmashed malt, vanilla, toffe and some coffe is there as well. 
Really dark red almost black colour with nice thick beige head. 
Taste is intense in chocolate, vanilla and toffee with some marshmalllow. The sweet chocolate and toffee taste is nicely finished of with a coffee bitterness and than return a bit in the finish which is more vanilla and chocolate than bitterness 
Full body with average carbonation and creamy texture. Could have had less carbonation for my taste  
A really nice beer. I really love this one not much that could been improved, just minor details.

Flaska från SB. En rejäl och välbalanserad Imperial kaffeporter. Kaffedoft- och smak är örtig och drar åt grön chili mot botten av en rejäl och maffig rostad chokladbotten och söta vaniljtoner. Riktigt god.
650 ml bottle. Dark brown with mocca head. Aroma of roasted mal, green chili, chocolate. Taste is with a lot of chocolate, roasted and burnt notes, chili and alcohol.

[My bottle (660ml) shared with mds, jercraigs & mabel.] Pours a very dark brown with a small semi-lasting bubbly tan head. Nice aroma of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Chocolaty flavour along with roasted malt, some coffee and vanilla. Light bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Very good, its so chocolaty!

Bottle. Pours smooth, thick black with hints of Amber. Nice thick head. Lots of coffee, chocolate and vanilla in aroma and taste. Surprisingly well balanced, with high carbonation which gives you a fresh mouth feel and extremely high drinkability. The only words I'm a say today are "beer", and "thank you" :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Pours black with a beige head, aroma of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, cognac, liquor, some cream, flavor of moka, honey, chocolate, brandy, wood, nice sweetness, nice acidity, some cherry, vanilla, burnt bitterness, medium to full bodied

Bottled. Pours reddishand deep brown with a small lacing, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, wood, vanilla and chocolate. Sweet flavor that ends up with bitter notes and slightly alcoholic. Medium bodid oily to syrupy text. and soft carb. A great porter.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Ar: coffee upfront, ashy, dry, heavy roastiness, then vanilla kicks in, subtle, but noticable, ABV very well hidden, chocolate cake, nutty, very refined.
Ap: black colour, medium beige head, lacing. 
T: big bite, lots of sweet vanilla, light acidity, heavy roastiness. Best vanilla infused flavour Ive had to date, salty. 
P: full bodied, soft carbonation, sweet, warming and roasty finish. 
O: marvelous.

2013-10-10. Black body with a modest tan head. 3++ Aroma of coffee has an almost hot pepper like quality to it that I do not care for, muted vanilla character. Flavour is similar with a sweet malt core and an odd melange of coffee and vanilla that has similar pepper like overtones as in the aroma. Smooth average plus bodied palate, peasant carbonation. 3+ Decent but a bit disappointing for me personally. Bottle shared by Blankboy.

22oz bottle in a snifter. Pours black with a lacy, tan head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, roasted malts, a little smokiness, some chocolate notes, and a light bitterness. Flavor the same with a great blend of everything. Average texture. A good imperial porter.
Dark Brown with small Light brown head. Roasted aroma, coffee beans, chocolate and some vanilla. The aroma arena also present in the taste.

Draught @ Smoke & Barrel, Washington, D.C. Pours cloudy very dark brown with small tan head. Dark aroma of malt,mcaramel, coffee and alcohol. Dark flavour of coffee, roasted malt, caramel and dark chocolate. Delicious aftertaste of freshly ground coffee beans. Perfectly balanced. Fantastic.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 Bottle: Deep obsidian color, very deep brown at the edges. Fine-bubbled, tan head that fades quicker than expected. Aroma is blasting with heavily roasted coffee beans; burnt, scorched, charred, ashy. Super roasty and even quite bitter. Lightly sweet vanilla aroma with some deeper, dark cocoa underneath the oily coffee beans. Taste is roasted, charred, burnt & oily coffee beans from left to right; intense French Roast beans. Lightly sweet vanilla coats mid-palate with a hint of charcoal and ash in the finish. Super dark and roasty plays well with the tiny amount of vanilla sweetness. Im a fan of bitter-roast over sticky-sweet in many cases. This porter is a winner for me.

Bottle.
Milk Choc, dark choc fennel and licorice aroma
Black, low head
Quite dry, sparkly, salty finish
Dark chocolate aftertaste.

22 oz bottle. Pours a nice thick black, with a dark tan head. The head fades quickly, leaving a stringy lace on the glass. The aroma is a gorgeous creamy vanilla, with notes of roasted coffee, and soft chocolate undertones. The taste starts out in that same vanilla and coffee indulgent half, and then the booze takes over. This is definitely an imperial that let's you know you're drinking it. The booze is overwhelming on the back end, and that booziness is what hangs around. If they could make the vanilla and coffee linger and cover the booze, this would be a 5, or damn close. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bubbly big tan head dark pour soft carbonation the aromas rich coffee bean caramel vanilla malt chocolate cocoa rich molasses the flavours cocoa superb roasted coffee beans dark rich coffee fudge molasses strong bitter taste perfect for a good imperial the roasted taste caresses the porter rich fruit no dried taste yes a lovely range of tastes in this porter vanilla chocolate really hits the spot the finish wonderful imperial some rich malts roasted tastes the input of vanilla a stirring bitter backing and dry cocoa taste first rate imperial porter
Tap at cannibal. Pours deep dark brown. Nose is super chocolate. Tastes of lots chocolate, tar, rootbeer, creamy and boozy. A tad rich and this certainly put me over edge to drunk town

Pours black with a small tan head. Swirling it leaves small lacerations. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, coffee, hazelnuts, slight boozy tones. Taste is vanilla, honey, coffee, hazelnuts, red currant, slight booze. Aftertaste is red berries, vanilla and honey. Very good!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark as the night. Aroma is beautiful - creamy vanilla, mild astringent coffee with a choc dessert smell. Taste is coffee bitterness, some small vibe of vanilla trailing at the end. Overall, a lovely imperial porter.
